programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria is the location for three more couples to demonstrate their cooking and hosting skills, kicking off with teachers Rory and Sam, who serve up dishes inspired by Europe. Day two sees Sarka and Paul lay on a Czech menu, but the massive portions defeat everyone - except the ever-hungry Rory. Finally, it's the turn of John and Sally with their retro 1980s evening. Which couple will win the cash prize of £1,000?.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan takes his sister to test drive a monster truck, Wendy comes across a handbag that could be very valuable, and Larry and Neil examine some works of art bought in a pub.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: A woman appears at Cashbrokers Pawnbrokers in Penzance with an autograph book signed by stars including the Rolling Stones and Cliff Richard. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick try to raise cash for a set of vintage cameras and an exclusive designer pen with a sky-high price tag.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirsty Allsopp help a family with a budget of £400,000 search for a dream property in Derbyshire. Londoners Bryone and Daniel Burton hope to run a holiday-letting business from their home, but their extensive list of requirements presents a challenge for the hosts. Meanwhile, fashion designer Wendy Lee and photographer Simon Mackney look for a studio.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: In the Hampshire-Berkshire borders, Marianne and Chris want to follow their dream of living the good life in the country, while keeping their high-powered jobs in town. Meanwhile, in Surrey, Fiona and Jonathan need a home together, but while he wants a countryside lifestyle and a mooring for his boat Fiona wants city living with all its shops, bars and cafe culture. Property expert Lucy Alexander helps both couples achieve all their aims.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Jeronime from Rooms 36 want to find out why their luxury B&B didn't hit the mark as the B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother Gemma Willock hosts the first party in the West Midlands, and her evening of glitz and glamour looks set to be a roaring success until an unwelcome revelation about her corner-cutting approach to the competition threatens her chances of taking the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mortgage adviser Andrew Devey throws the second party in the West Midlands, hosting a beatnik-themed evening. He cooks shepherd's pie for his main course, as well as lining up some pop art in the hope that it will expand his guests' minds.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jules Evans hosts the third day of the competition in the West Midlands, and plans to indulge her passion for historical re-enactments by planning a medieval-themed dinner. The guests offer mixed responses when they look at the menu, but things take a turn for the better when she announces a duel will form part of the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Massage therapist Lucy Hird hosts the fourth dinner party from the West Midlands, featuring an extensive menu full of Thai specialities. She also gives individual presents to her guests, but her night is compromised by the entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mental-health nurse Lloyd Cast hosts the final dinner party from the West Midlands. Despite appearing to be an extrovert so far, he decides on a chilled theme for the evening to allow his food to take centre stage, before the winner of the £1,000 is announced.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. Gordon discovers a family tragedy that explains why this couple have become trapped in their business and wrestling with debt.(n)

programme.title: Who Wants My Council House
programme.desc: Documentary following five households looking to swap their council house. Some want to upgrade to their ideal home, others simply fancy a change of scenery and some are parents seeking to downsize now that their children have flown the nest. However, council house swaps do not involve estate agents with sharp sales patter. It is up to the tenants to show each other around their homes and do the hard sell. If the first viewing goes well, there will be an invitation for a return viewing before both sides decide whether to swap - or not.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Self-proclaimed family man James looks forward to the arrival of his fifth child and Kirsty, who was the first triplet to be delivered at Liverpool Women's Hospital returns to have her own baby, hoping motherhood is the key to a more independent life. Meanwhile, an unexpected pregnancy for Jo, still living with her parents at the age of 35, means a busy retirement for first-time grandparents Jean and John.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet animal clips, with videos featuring extreme shepherding in Wales, the tale of a vengeful lion in Africa, and a New Zealand monster mystery.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: New series. The return of the programme in which Sheriff Jamey Noel tries to root out crime and corruption in an Indiana prison, sending eight more volunteers into Clark County Jail as undercover inmates to help him understand more about how drugs and contraband are getting into the facility. The first edition follows former corrections officer Sheri, ex-army reserve medic Ryan, retired police officer Quintin. and Monalisa, whose own daughter is incarcerated.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe reflect on the highs and lows from the World Para Athletics Championships, currently taking place in London. The trio are joined by comedian Johnny Vegas, Paralympic double gold medallist Liam Malone and many other current and former participants.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: The team investigates big-brand baby foods and finds some unexpected ingredients, while Fairy Original's longer-lasting claim is put to the test. Anna Richardson and Andi Osho check out if readers' offers are really as good as they sound and look into the high street in-store experiences that tempt us to spend again.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Five Bells near Dover, where manager Shelley Parnell and her competitive mum Linda Yates hope their bargain-priced B&B will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts check in to the Thomas Paine Hotel in Thetford, where an inappropriate book is found in a bedside drawer and competition turns fierce at a Home Guard training exercise.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sarah Whitehead invite their fellow hoteliers to Tenbury Wells in Worcestershire, where they open the doors of their historic pub The Rose and Crown.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lesley and Steve Hawker welcome the contestants to the Woodlands Guest House in Exmoor, but after the bad feedback of previous rounds, it seems their rivals are out for revenge.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up to find out what they have been paid. Shelley and Linda from The Five Bells want to know why their feedback for breakfast doesn't add up, while Gez from the Thomas Paine Hotel wants to find out why Shelley and Linda scored him so low. Chris and Sarah from The Rose and Crown want to question Gez, and Steve and Lesley from Woodlands Guest House try to get to the naked truth.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first of a week of dinner parties in Belfast is hosted by 30-year-old mobile phone sales manager Steve, who hopes to impress guests Justin, Julie, Cushla and Marty.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: As the competition continues in Belfast, hairbrush executive Julie hopes to charm her way to the prize with an evening of fusion food inspired by her time in Japan and Hong Kong.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Belfast, mobile barista Justin hosts the latest dinner party, hoping his barbecue extravaganza will wow the guests, with even the dessert to be toasted on the coals.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Belfast sees executive assistant Cushla trying to win over her guests with some impressive cuisine, while Steve continues to dominate with his dodgy impressions.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Garage owner Marty hosts the final dinner party of the week in Belfast, but after a week of endless Bo' Selecta! impressions, Steve is beginning to get on everyone's nerves.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick pushes the boundaries of veterinary medicine, and treats a German shepherd puppy that needs surgery on his hips and front leg using groundbreaking cell treatment. The vet must also perform delicate surgery on a Chihuahua suffering from a neck deformity compressing its spinal cord - however, one false move could be fatal. Plus, a rescue dog with deformed front legs is brought into the surgery.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan, and Bill Bailey in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: A martial arts master uses a tournament to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Action(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Chain-smoking loner Constantine tries to buy his place in Heaven by banishing Earth-bound demons back to Hell. But his fate is tied up with Angela, a cop investigating the alleged suicide of her twin(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs through the lens of three product launches(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow fixer decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the centre of a conspiratorial maelstrom(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of national pride and Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: Jim Sheridan's Oscar-nominated drama stars Paddy Considine as Johnny, a would-be actor, who emigrates from Ireland to New York with his wife Sarah and daughters Christy and Ariel. While he searches for work, his wife tries to keep the family above the poverty line, with their lives complicated by enigmatic neighbour Mateo, who alternates between rages and affection for the family(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: Peyton was once a happily married woman, but when her doctor husband is accused of assaulting a patient and he commits suicide, her world falls apart and she plots revenge. Claire, the woman who made the accusation, hires Peyton as a nanny, not knowing of their past involvement. Peyton then proceeds to terrorize the family, attempts to seduce the husband and generally destroy Claire as she feels she has been destroyed(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Two pals grow up with the same vocation; one becomes a rabbi, the other a Catholic priest. But their faith and friendship are tested when old schoolfriend Anna Reilly shows up in town. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, decide to throw one last party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going awry in this raunchy and ridiculous comedy(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook is finally determined to have a kid on her own now that she is 37. But when she discovers that she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant, the driven Kate finds in working girl Angie Ostrowiski an unlikely surrogate. Everything is apparently going well. That until Angie shows up at Kate doorstep with no place to live. The two opposites try to get along and, in the middle of their tug-of-war, they discover that there can be a different kind of family(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: Determined to go straight, he only agrees to take part in a shady business deal at his attorney's instigation in order to discharge the debt of gratitude he owes. Despite his intentions and love for his girlfriend, Carlito finds himself relentlessly drawn back into the world he sought to escape(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: Reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Nixon's resignation(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: An epic version of the legendary western sheriff-gunslinger, Wyatt Earp's life story, who lived from 1848 to 1929. Growing up on a farm in Iowa, Earp tries to run away to join the Union Army in the Civil War, but he is turned away because of his youth. Instead, he studies law and marries Urilla Sutherland. But Urilla dies of typhoid fever before they can have children, and Earp grows despondent and loses his way(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Based on a novel by Elleston Trevor, director John Moore's The Flight of the Phoenix is a remake of a 1965 film of the same name starring film icon James Stewart. The story revolves around the plight of Captain Frank Towns (Dennis Quaid), a pilot whose C-119 cargo plane full of oil workers could not withstand the violent winds of a desert sandstorm. Stranded in the harsh terrain of Mongolia's Gobi Desert (a departure from the original, in which the plane crashed in the Sahara), Frank and his navigator face an equal challenge in maintaining order among the survivors. The group of oilmen had planned on an uneventful trip to shut off a group of rigs falling below their productivity expectations -- not fending for their very lives. Before long, some men are revealed as cowards, while others exhibit a surprising show of strength, all the while hoping that the wreckage of the original plane can be salvaged before a Lord of the Flies situation occurs. Miranda Otto is featured in a supporting role, as well as Giovanni Ribisi and Tyrese Gibson(n)

programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Baby.
programme.desc: A known criminal is attacked and dies of his wounds inside a church while protecting a baby to whom he has no known association. Castle and Beckett find themselves caring for the newborn as they try to track down the parents while chasing the killer. Drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A police officer is shot dead and the chief suspect's confession appears to bring an end to the matter, but his media-savvy lawyer presents a case accusing the force of a string of errors - as well as perceived racism. Guest starring Gregory Hines, in his final acting role before his death.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal stabbing of a taxi driver whose body was left under his vehicle. The finger of suspicion points to a man who took a drunken ride in the cab on the same night - an ex-convict who is also a gifted writer - and his protege, whose fingerprints were found on a book and cigar left at the scene. Saul Rubinek, JK Simmons and Sonia Braga guest star alongside Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The return of the crime drama. The fire department and the police are celebrating Mac's recovery at an ice-hockey game when both services are called away to deal with a blaze, which triggers an explosion that kills one of those attending the scene. Evidence leads Mac and the team to arsonist Leonard Brooks, who has just been released from prison after serving 15 years. Rob Morrow (Numb3rs) guest stars, with Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: A Mother Betrayed
programme.desc: Five years after her husband is run off the road and killed by a mysterious driver, the head of a prosperous architectural firm decides to remarry. However, she's unaware that her new spouse has a devious plan to steal her daughter, her sanity and even her life. Psychological thriller, starring Lynn Collins, Adam Kaufman and Joanna Cassidy.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: A Mother Betrayed
programme.desc: Five years after her husband is run off the road and killed by a mysterious driver, the head of a prosperous architectural firm decides to remarry. However, she's unaware that her new spouse has a devious plan to steal her daughter, her sanity and even her life. Psychological thriller, starring Lynn Collins, Adam Kaufman and Joanna Cassidy.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. To complicate matters further, the missing man's outspoken spouse happens to be the ex-wife of both Gibbs and Fornell. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.sub-title: Just a Girl in the World.
programme.desc: A crime-scene investigator is killed in her apartment, and evidence initially leads Lupo and Bernard to her fiance - until a journalist is attacked by a taxi driver, and DNA evidence opens up an entirely new line of inquiry. Drama, starring Jeremy Sisto.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate after an aspiring musician is found dead behind a bin, and a bag of money left nearby leads them to a number of suspects. One of them confesses to the shooting, but says he only did it because he thought his daughter had been abducted. Further investigation by the detectives reveals that there may be a link between their case and a possible terrorist threat. Guest starring Michael Kenneth Williams (The Wire, Boardwalk Empire).(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The co-owner and bartender of an exclusive nightclub is robbed and murdered. Hawkes finds blood on the victim's watch that leads to a suspect, while the toxicity report reveals a build up of formic acid in the deceased's system, a possible result of methanol ingestion. Meanwhile, Adam spends his day off with his father, who has Alzheimer's. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Hill Harper and Anna Belknap.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An estate agent and two clients discover the body of Lt Com Maya Burris, a naval attache who had been working in Egypt, and her detective husband Nick arrives on the scene to demand answers. Using documents discovered on the victim's boat, Abby links her to Barry Norton, who is suspected of having sold government secrets to a Middle Eastern terrorist group known as the SRC.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs goes into his favourite diner for a cup of coffee and finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun, forcing him to question choices he has made in the past and present. The action then flashes back a few days to when he and the rest of the team members were investigating the death of a petty officer on board USS Gentry, which has been undergoing repairs in dry dock. The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: DNA provides the team a suspect in a bank robbery - Stanley Vaughn, who served two years for involuntary manslaughter. While DA Hardin pushes Dekker to use California's `three strikes' law to put Vaughn away permanently, the suspect's junk-strewn apartment offers up little concrete evidence and the two fall out over the best way to proceed. However, the garden contains something explosive, suggesting that Vaughn has bigger plans on the horizon. Crime drama, starring Terrence Howard and Peter Coyote.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Two children are found handcuffed to their seats but miraculously alive in the back of a van submerged in a river. The ensuing investigation links the case to a mysterious death involving a controversial therapy technique, and eventually leads the team to a seemingly abusive foster family. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler struggle to identify the cause of a woman's death in Central Park, and follow a trail of clues that leads to a mute homeless man, who turns out to be a better witness than anticipated. After they discover a rare toxic agent was the murder weapon, and that the victim was a millionaire, they suspect her husband could be the culprit because his dance troupe had been in financial difficulty. Guest starring Chris Sarandon (ER), with Mariska Harqitay and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Briscoe and Green try to discover the identity of a masked youngster who opened fire on classmates, killing four and wounding several others. They soon learn more than one student fits the profile - and finding the perpetrator is given added urgency by the arrival of e-mails threatening more murders. Starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach, with a guest appearance by Carey Lowell.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac is found at the harbour in Jersey City, having escaped from a sinking car, but he is suffering from concussion and can recall only scant details of his kidnapping. However, the team resolves to track down his abductor and believes CCTV footage of the suspect driving through a toll barrier in another vehicle is just the lead required. Starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The team embarks on a desperate search to find the source of a radioactive substance that claimed a woman's life at a concert and hospitalised Sid, who was exposed to it while examining the body. Evidence leads them to the antiquities section of the New York library - and the finger of suspicion points to a former employee who bore a grudge. Guest starring Maroon 5.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Wolfe disturbs a miniature coffin during inquiries at a murder scene, triggering a series of strange events that convinces him the entire investigation is cursed. The approach of Halloween reinforces his belief that mysterious forces are at work - and it is not long before everyone else begins to share the same view. With Jonathan Togo.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla serves up a stern slice of justice for a contractor who took a couple's savings to build a balcony and a backyard oasis, but left the project not fit for purpose.(n)

programme.title: Her Evil Twin
programme.desc: A married couple are struggling with their crumbling relationship when the wife receives a letter informing her that she has a previously unknown long-lost twin sister. The husband then begins a torrid affair with his newfound sister-in-law, but soon finds she is treacherous and dangerous. Thriller, starring Sonya Walger and Ben Bass.(n)

programme.title: Amish Abduction
programme.desc: A young Amish woman visits her cousin in Charm, Ohio for the summer, where she discovers another world and finds friendship. But she soon has to choose which life she wants. Drama, starring Trevor Donovan and Daniella Chuchran.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Uneasy Lies the Crown
programme.desc: A dentist with gambling debts discovers his wife is having an affair with one of his patients and wants a divorce. He plans to take revenge by poisoning the lover with his wife's heart medication, so she will be suspected - but he reckons without the attentions of the crumpled cop. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, James Read, Paul Burke, Jo Anderson and Nancy Walker.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. After being stationed in Kabul, she became pregnant by a local man called Amir who was later killed in action - and Abby discovers he was the sole male heir of a wealthy family that owns a large tract of land in a politically sensitive part of Afghanistan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. She identifies the murderer as Seal-turned-assassin Marcellus Dane, who is suspected of working for Casey Stratton - a member of black ops unit Phantom Eight. Guest starring Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The agents try to track down the Navy employee responsible for uploading sensitive documents onto an internet blog. Discovering the owner of the website has been tortured and killed, they realise the culprits were trying to obtain the decryption key to access the classified material.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A blogger who devoted his energies to exposing corruption within government is found dead and it transpires he had recently suggested that some Navy Seals had overstepped the mark in their use of force. As the team gets to grips with the case hoping the claims are wrong, another body turns up with its tongue removed, and near the body a hair is found that guides investigators to a suspect - a Navy Seal. However, the possibility that the team is being deliberately led astray remains. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The Navy's finest female pilot dies at an air show while demonstrating a state-of-the-art aircraft about to be brought into service. Fearing the press will have a field day over the capability of women pilots, a senior Navy officer calls for the team's help to determine the cause. While the evidence initially points to error, a new autopsy reveals another line of inquiry, which ends in the investigators racing to prevent another accident. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman stops taking her medication and kills 10 people with her car - but the blame for the offence falls on a former rock star waging a campaign against psychiatric drugs. programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: Francis Ford Copolla's classic film version of the insular world of the Mafia is a film less about mob rub-outs and cops-and-robbers chases than it is about family loyalty and the transfer of power from one generation to another. The film begins in the study of Don Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando), who is dispensing favors to various supplicants, while outside of his dark, shadowy office, the wedding of his daughter Connie (Talia Shire) is taking place. At the wedding, Connie's brothers are on hand for the joyous celebration -- Michael (Al Pacino), Vito's youngest son and returning war hero; Sonny (James Caan), the hair-trigger tempered oldest son; Fredo (John Cazale), the meek and weak-willed middle son; and Tom Hagen (Robert Duvall), the skillful, quiet, and efficient adopted son, who is also Vito's chief counsel. The wedding is Vito Corleone at the height of his power and influence. As World War II has ended and changes in the world have occurred, changes are also occurring within the Mob hierarchy. The other Mafia families want to get into the drug trade, but Vito is adamantly against it. When a powerful drug supplier, Sollozzo (Al Lettieri), promises big profits for the families, the other family heads are interested, but Vito stands firm. This seals his fate. In the ensuing brutal mob war that takes place, Sonny (Vito's successor in the business) is gunned down and an assassination attempt is made on Vito. Michael, the one son of Vito's who has refused to become involved in the family business, now finds himself forced to take the reins of power. With Vito slowly slipping away into old age and illness, Michael now effectively takes command of the Corleone family. After the death of his father, Michael must now ruthlessly plot his revenge against the families for conspiring against the Corleone Family(n)

programme.title: The Godfather, Part II
programme.desc: Oscar-winning sequel about the dealings of a New York Mafia family. The early life of Vito Corleone after his emigration from Sicily to the United States is contrasted with his son's swift and bloody rise to the position of Mafia don(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Zorro
programme.desc: This is perhaps the best of the many Zorro films as Tyrone Power gives an outstanding performance as the alternately swishing and swashbuckling son of a 19th century California aristocrat. As a champion of the oppressed, Zorro must face a wicked governor portrayed by J. Edward Bromberg, who, of course, has a beautiful niece whom our hero loves. Basil Rathbone is a delightfully evil assistant to the governor. Based on Johnston McCulley's novel The Curse of Capistrano, The Mark of Zorro was a remake of the 1920 silent film and by far superior to all the Zorro incarnations. Interspersed with humor and one-liners but still keeping up with the highest of swashbuckling traditions, it is an action-packed story of one man standing against a corrupt, oppressive government on behalf of those less able to bear their burdens(n)

programme.title: Fred Claus

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk. An affectionate homage to the 'creature features' of the 50s(n)

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: In this spy-thriller former MI-5 agent Will Holloway (Kit Harington) is forced to partner with Harry Pierce (Peter Firth), the MI5 Intelligence Chief who decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist Adem Qasim (Elyes Gabel) who escaped during routine prisoner transport. A disgraced Harry faked his death after the Qasim escaped and Will was brought back into the MI-5 fold to locate Harry and return him to headquarters. Harry convinces Will that there is a traitor in MI-5 and they must work together to prevent a terrorist attack on the city of London. The film is based on the British television series Spooks created by David Wolstencroft. Directed by Bharat Nalluri. Cast includes Lara Pulver, David Harewood and Jennifer Ehle(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Horror remake. A young family move to a big house in the New York suburbs which they bought at a bargain price. But when they start to be terrorised by supernatural forces, they discover the house was the scene of a recent mass killing and was also the home of an 18th-century satanist(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility in this nightmarish sci-fi thriller(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of professional climbers successfully scale Mount Everest only to be faced with tragedy when a monster storm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent. Jake Gyllenhaal, Josh Brolin, Jason Clarke, and John Hawkes co-star. Directed by Baltasar Kormakur (2 Guns)(n)

programme.desc: WWE star John Cena headlines his sophomore action picture as a police officer whose wife is kidnapped in New Orleans. Daniel Kunka provides the script, with Deep Blue Sea's Renny Harlin handling the directing duties for the 20-million-dollar Fox Atomic/WWE Films production(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: A car thief is forced out of retirement to save his brother from gangsters(n)

programme.desc: A detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law, both of whom are cops(n)

programme.title: Tremors II: Aftershocks
programme.desc: The desert-dwelling giant worms (aka 'graboids') return to terrorise an oil field in Mexico. Earl, a survivor of their first attack, is enlisted to stop them, but finds that their offspring are even more vicious. Tongue-in-cheek horror sequel(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Science fiction thriller in which a scientist battles to convince the authorities of an imminent alien attack. Zane Zaminski is a radio astronomer who believes he has heard an extra-terrestrial signal, but whose discovery is deemed worthless by his boss. Then his research division is closed down due to government cutbacks and he is given the sack. Undeterred, Zane establishes a makeshift radio telescope within his own home and joins forces with fellow scientist Ilana Green ( Lindsay Crouse ) to find out more about this alien life-force which, it seems, has its own plans for Planet Earth..(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: Frank Morrison watches helplessly as smooth but creepy Rick Barnes wins his ex-wife and son. Danny's a troubled kid who tends to lie, but Frank takes his suspicions seriously. Has Barnes really committed murder? Tense thriller(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realise that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Tough detective Popeye Doyle is left chasing shadows as he tries to nail one of the biggest drugs smugglers in New York, and possibly the world(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: A mother and her young daughter, who are trying to start a new life for themselves, move in to a spooky, dilapidated apartment. When a mysterious damp patch on the ceiling grows and her daughter starts talking of an imaginary friend, she begins to wonder whether supernatural forces are at work. Remake of a 2002 Japanese film of the same name(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance

It's been over a decade since audiences last saw New York cop John McClane (Willis), but now, as the world's greatest criminal mastermind (Timothy Olyphant) attempts to cripple the entire country with an innovative act of technological terrorism, only one cop can insure that the integrity of the system stays intact. programme.desc: A look back at yesterday's action.(n)

programme.desc: Reports and previews.(n)

programme.title: Racing News
programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.title: Raceday Live
programme.desc: Coverage of today's meeting from the Curragh.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood help a hard-working nurse who has to rely on the bank of mum and dad, despite working full-time.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts look around very different properties, from a modern detached house, to a listed cottage and a terraced house ripe for extending.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Following the work of neighbourhood policing teams, who use alternative methods to tackle crime in conjunction with members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate problems viewers have had with flights. Plus, the vital travel documents that holidaymakers need to be aware of.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined in York by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. The reds and blue teams have the choice of two antique centres to buy three items to take to auction in Darlington. Eric also finds out about the city's long association with confectionery at its Castle Museum.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, featuring Sam Querrey v Marin Cilic and Roger Federer v Tomas Berdych in the men's singles semi-finals. Querrey ended Andy Murray's hopes of retaining the title in the quarter-finals to reach his maiden Grand Slam semi-final, while Cilic finally reached this stage by defeating Gilles Muller, having fallen in the last eight in each of the previous three years. Seven-time champion Federer has reached this stage without dropping a set, but will take nothing for granted against the 2010 runner-up.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Comedian Rob Beckett and Alex Jones co-host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren prepares to wave goodbye to Walford - will Steven discover her plan before it is too late? Will and Denny fear that Keegan will be out for revenge after their prank, while Michelle comes clean about her past to Tom. Jack is forced to talk to Ingrid about her time-keeping and Bernadette apologises to Jane for destroying her flowers.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: Michael finds himself with a whole new family on a birthday outing, and a treat soon turns into a terrifying battle for survival as Arthur's money-making schemes cause chaos. Comedy, with Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back on his eventful career, shining a light on dieting. Plus, Car Share's John and Kayleigh are both in tears, and there's a special appearance by veteran snooker player Dennis Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A hypnotist is booked to provide the entertainment at the triplets' baptism - and Agnes soon finds herself under his spell. Meanwhile, the matriarch's kitchen is falling apart - but that turns out to be the least of her problems when son Mark delivers some heartbreaking news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy offends father-in-law Frank by casting doubt on his ability to mind the children while she and Lee enjoy an evening out at the ballet. Sally Bretton co-stars, alongside veteran comedy performer Bobby Ball and Outnumbered's Hugh Dennis.(n)

programme.title: Blades of Glory
programme.desc: A bad-boy figure skater and his effeminate arch-enemy are banned from the sport after their intense rivalry results in a brawl. However, the pair find a loophole in the regulations allowing them to enter the world championships as the first ever same-sex pair - if they can put aside their differences long enough to compete. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Jon Heder, Will Arnett and Amy Poehler.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: TV presenter Julian Clary joins Donal Skehan in the kitchen, where he samples dishes prepared by chef Jun Tanaka, and former Great British Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge demonstrates recipes for an outdoor summer lunch, including salmon fillets with herb sauce, ham with home-made chutney, and fillet of beef with garlic and mustard cream. To accompany the cold meats and fish, Mary prepares two salads - one with fiery red rice, and the other featuring broad bean and little gem - and finishes off by making a summer pudding. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents coverage of the ladies' singles final between Garbine Muguruza and Venus Williams at the All England Club. Muguruza's previous two Grand Slam finals were both against Venus' sister Serena, and she experienced mixed fortunes in them. She lost the first one here in 2015, before gaining revenge in the French Open last year. Her 37-year-old opponent has become the oldest Grand Slam singles finalist since Martina Navratilova finished runner-up here in 1994, and is looking for her sixth Wimbledon title, but her first since 2008.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman invite more famous faces to take part in the general knowledge quiz. This time, stars from the world of soaps - both past and present - are challenged to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Former EastEnders Joe Swash (Micky Miller) and John Altman (Nick Cotton) join forces, veteran Hollyoaks actor Nick Pickard (Tony Hutchinson) teams up with old co-star Ali Bastian (Becca Dean), Waterloo Road secretary Victoria Bush (Sonya Donnegan) partners former student Zaraah Abrahams (Michaela White) and Holby City nurse Tina Hobley (Chrissie Williams) reunites with her on-screen mother Sharon Maughan (Tricia Williams).(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The choral music contest reaches its fifth heat, as another six diverse groups seek to demonstrate their vocal skills. This time, the ensembles are young chamber choir Tring Park 16, West Midlands-based musical theatre enthusiasts Crescendo, Oxford University a capella group Oxford Alternotives, classical quintet Vox-Xover, all-girl pop ensemble Vocalities, and Dublin barbershop choir The Ramparts. Each group is given a chance to display their speciality with a `showstopper' performance, before battling it out with their rivals in a themed `riff-off'. Guest judge Joe Jonas joins Gareth Malone and Kelis on the panel. Postponed from Saturday 8th July.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tensions between Jez, Iain, Mickey and Scott look set to reach fever pitch after Mickey is brought in to the ED, having been injured during a police chase following a race-related assault on a shopkeeper. Desperate to keep his relationship secret from his hardline brother Scott, Mickey puts on a front and insults Jez, but when Iain realises Scott has intimidated the shopkeeper's wife into silence, he decides to make use of his knowledge to ensure justice is done. Meanwhile, Max takes an interest in attractive mortuary assistant Tara during a speed-dating session at the Hope & Anchor, but the situation becomes complicated after Tara faints, resulting in an illuminating trip back to the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard with a Vengeance
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane returns to duty following an explosion at a department store in the city. The perpetrator contacts the police and tells them that unless McClane and an unfortunate bystander who was in the wrong place at the wrong time carry out a series of instructions to the letter, more bombs will be detonated. Action thriller sequel, starring Bruce Willis, Samuel L Jackson and Jeremy Irons.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Vanessa Feltz joins Brian Conley to discuss the TV shows she enjoyed in her formative years, revealing a passion for all things romance via Crossroads, The Onedin Line and Bouquet of Barbed Wire. However, she also reveals a passion for children's show Crackerjack and some early advertisements.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: A busy mum who enjoys pricey beauty treatments is shown a few ways to pamper herself at a fraction of the cost. Plus, catching up with families who had a makeover last series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from London's Portobello Road, as experts Natasha Raskin and Thomas Plant support the red and blue teams scouring the famous street market. Catherine Southon acts as auctioneer.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage on day 11 at the All England Club, featuring the latter stages of the doubles competitions. The ladies' doubles semi-finals last year involved the unseeded Williams sisters, Venus and Serena. The American duo defeated the eighth-seeded German-Czech pairing of Julia Goerges and Karolina Pliskova 7-6, 6-4 to advance to their first Wimbledon doubles final since 2012. Timea Babos and Yaroslava Shvedova would be their opponents in that showpiece match, having defeated the Williams' compatriots Raquel Atawo and Abigail Spears 6-4, 6-2 in the other semi-final. In the mixed doubles, unseeded home favourite Heather Watson's fairytale journey continued as she progressed to the semi-finals with her Finnish partner Henri Kontinen.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding and guests look back at the men's singles semi-finals, and preview tomorrow's ladies' singles final. Current world number one Andy Murray and Canada's Milos Raonic reached the men's final last year following respective victories against Tomas Berdych and Roger Federer, while Serena Williams faced Angelique Kerber in the ladies' final.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.sub-title: First Night of the Proms - Part Two.
programme.desc: New series. Part two of two. BBC Two picks up the baton from BBC Four as Katie Derham introduces further coverage of the First Night of the Proms from London's Royal Albert Hall. The evening culminates with Harmonium, a choral work by American music titan John Adams, who celebrates his 70th birthday this year. Harmonium is a thrilling and captivating setting of poetry by John Donne and Emily Dickinson, performed by the BBC Symphony Orchestra, BBC Symphony Chorus and the BBC Proms Youth Choir, conducted by Edward Gardner. Part one can be seen on BBC Four at 8pm.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: The comedian tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's news. Sara Pascoe and Katherine Ryan are on hand to take Frankie to task over his claims. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: Tui Mitcham is still missing and the community is beginning to buckle under the weight of suspicion, but Robin makes a breakthrough in the investigation - though Al warns her that her dark past is affecting her judgement. She also rekindles her relationship with old flame Johnno Mitcham, but the reopening of old wounds leads to violence. Thriller set in New Zealand, starring Elisabeth Moss and Thomas M Wright.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: A violent incident sees Robin thrown off the case and the police quietly wind down their investigation as there have been no leads and Tui is presumed dead. But the detective refuses to give up and carries on her inquiries unofficially, uncovering mobile-phone footage suggesting the girl might still be alive. Thriller set in New Zealand, starring Elisabeth Moss.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Britain's Food & Farming: The Brexit Effect - Panorama.
programme.desc: The EU dictates what farmers are allowed to grow, sets animal welfare standards and offers a large supply of cheap labour to work in the fields and processing plants. In this programme, Tom Heap talks to insiders who claim Brexit will mean higher prices, lower quality and less choice on the supermarket shelves, as well as others who believe it's a fantastic opportunity to address inefficiency and design a new mode of food production for the next generation. Will UK consumers back British farmers, or switch to potentially cheaper imports of hormone-filled meat from abroad?.(n)

programme.title: The Passengers That Took on the Train Line
programme.desc: Jacques Peretti rallies together a group of commuters on London's South Eastern rail network to bid for their own train line, to see if they can do a better job than one of Britain's biggest operators. The passengers come together to try to take a railway franchise into their own hands, but can they persuade the Department for Transport to see this new passenger-run company as a viable option?.(n)

programme.title: This World
programme.desc: An examination of the persecution and discrimination of people with albinism in Tanzania and Malawi, East Africa. Doctor Oscar Duke, who himself has albinism, embarks on a journey to discover what life is like for people who share his condition in these countries. He meets young people facing the brunt of discrimination, from a 15-year-old who was mutilated in an attack, to the 280 children placed in a secure camp for people with albinism in Tanzania. Oscar also confronts some of those responsible for making these people's lives a living hell - and comes face to face with an `albino hunter' imprisoned for murder.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Sylvia Scarlett
programme.desc: A French criminal is forced to flee the country with her equally crooked father and resorts to disguising herself as a boy to avoid attention. Her secret is discovered by a suave English jewel thief, who invites them to join forces with him. Romantic comedy, starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant, Brian Aherne and Edmund Gwenn.(n)

programme.title: A Walk in the Sun
programme.desc: A US Army infantry patrol joins the 1943 invasion of Italy, and a series of casualties leaves a corporal in charge of the men. They are selected for a special mission to seize a farmhouse that German forces have turned into a fortified hideout. Second World War adventure, starring Dana Andrews, Richard Conte and Sterling Holloway.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty catches two blue sharks that have crossed the Atlantic and attaches tags to their dorsal fins so their migration routes can be tracked. He is also called to investigate surprising reports that a dolphin has begun attacking swimmers.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Coverage of the ladies' wheelchair singles and men's wheelchair doubles finals, on the penultimate day of action at the third Grand Slam tournament of the year.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate quality produce that needs to be cooked with the respect it deserves, as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo argue that, while convenience food serves a purpose, only the best ingredients and perfect cooking can produce something truly delicious.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden Planet
programme.desc: Space travellers journey to an unexplored world, where another spaceship disappeared without trace 20 years previously. They find the planet inhabited only by mysterious scientist Dr Morbius, his beautiful daughter and their robot servant. However, Morbius doesn't take kindly to intruders entering his domain and it soon becomes clear that sinister forces are at work beneath the planet's idyllic facade. Sci-fi drama loosely based on Shakespeare's The Tempest, starring Walter Pidgeon, Anne Francis, Leslie Nielsen and Warren Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Aaron Shah, who has been captivated by his grandmother's home movies of a trip Down Under, tries to persuade his partner Amy they should move from the North of England to Australia as they sample life in Adelaide for a week.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: A millionaire tries to save jungle tigers on the Indonesian island of Sumatra by capturing them in their natural habitat, then transporting them to his own land and setting them free. However, zoologist Alan Rabinowitz is unsure about the wisdom of his scheme, particularly given the dangers the big cats pose to humans, and decides to investigate further.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Will Axon assess items at Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, including a Busby hat and a Worcester coffee set. Presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents coverage of the men's and ladies' doubles finals from SW19, on the 13th day of this year's tournament. The men's final in 2016 was an all-French affair, with top seeds Nicolas Mahut and Pierre-Hugues Herbert defeating Julien Benneteau and Edouard Roger-Vasselin in straight sets. In the ladies' final, just hours after her singles final victory over Angelique Kerber, Serena Williams paired up with sister Venus to take the title for a sixth time.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the day's play, where the ladies' singles final was the main attraction on Centre Court. The host also casts her eye over the men's and ladies' doubles finals, and presents a round-up of the latest news, as the famous event drew ever closer to a finish.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine: Chris Ofili - The Caged Bird's Song.
programme.desc: Alan Yentob catches up with celebrated Turner Prize-winning artist Chris Ofili, as he completes work on The Caged Bird's Song, a new piece set to receive its exhibition debut at London's National Gallery. Best known as a painter, Ofili switches mediums with his latest piece, working alongside expert weavers in Edinburgh to create a wool tapestry seven meters wide and three meters tall. With The Caged Bird's Song, Ofili aims to demonstrate his ongoing fascination with classical mythology and contemporary `demigods', while also paying tribute to the landscape of his adopted island home of Trinidad.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Tom Allen (the latter having just appeared romping around on Channel 4's Crystal Maze). As usual, the contestants engage in various rounds of topical stand-up and improvisation as they try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz show, making a meal of some M-themed food topics as Cariad Lloyd, Dermot O'Leary and Phill Jupitus compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sitcom star and The Last Leg regular Josh Widdicombe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He'll be warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Londoner Nathan Caton and Celia Pacquola from Australia.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents highlights of the third round of the European Tour event at Dundonald Links in Troon, Ayrshire, where Alexander Noren entered as the defending champion.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Gary Davies introduce performances by Galaxy, the Weather Girls, Sade, Bananarama, Howard Jones, Tracey Ullman and Nena. First shown March 8, 1984.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.sub-title: First Night of the Proms - Part One.
programme.desc: New series. Part one of two. Katie Derham introduces the first of the Promenade concerts from London's Royal Albert Hall. Beethoven's dramatic Third Piano Concerto is performed by star soloist Igor Levit with the BBC Symphony Orchestra and conductor Edward Gardner. This opening concert of the world's biggest music festival also includes a raucous new work by Tom Coult, St John's Dance, the first of 13 world premieres during the season. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Tales from the Tour Bus: Rock 'n' Roll on the Road
programme.desc: Rick Wakeman offers a first-hand account of rockers on the road from the late 1950s onwards, recalling the golden age of touring - a secret history of transport cafes, transit vans, B&Bs, sleepless roadies and loved ones left at home. The musician and tour bus aficionado also reflects on the audiences, both good and bad, and the gigs themselves, from the early variety package to the pubs, clubs and stadiums. With contributions by Suzi Quatro and members of Dr Feelgood, the Shadows, the Pretty Things, Fairport Convention, Happy Mondays, Aswad, Girlschool and the Damned.(n)

programme.title: Great Guitar Riffs at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive clips and performances which include some of the most memorable guitar riffs of all time. Featuring Jimi Hendrix, the Kinks, Cream, AC/DC, the Smiths, Rage Against the Machine, Radiohead, Foo Fighters, Pixies and the Stone Roses.(n)

programme.title: Joy of the Guitar Riff
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the impact of the guitar riff on popular music over the past 60 years, including a look at how it became the foundation on which rock 'n' roll was built. With stories from Brian May, Dave Davies, Hank Marvin, Joan Jett, Nile Rodgers, Tony Iommi, Robert Fripp, Johnny Marr and more. Narrated by Lauren Laverne.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Gary Davies introduce performances by Galaxy, the Weather Girls, Sade, Bananarama, Howard Jones, Tracey Ullman and Nena. First shown March 8, 1984.(n)

programme.title: Tales from the Tour Bus: Rock 'n' Roll on the Road
programme.desc: Rick Wakeman offers a first-hand account of rockers on the road from the late 1950s onwards, recalling the golden age of touring - a secret history of transport cafes, transit vans, B&Bs, sleepless roadies and loved ones left at home. The musician and tour bus aficionado also reflects on the audiences, both good and bad, and the gigs themselves, from the early variety package to the pubs, clubs and stadiums. With contributions by Suzi Quatro and members of Dr Feelgood, the Shadows, the Pretty Things, Fairport Convention, Happy Mondays, Aswad, Girlschool and the Damned.(n)

programme.title: Great Guitar Riffs at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive clips and performances which include some of the most memorable guitar riffs of all time. Featuring Jimi Hendrix, the Kinks, Cream, AC/DC, the Smiths, Rage Against the Machine, Radiohead, Foo Fighters, Pixies and the Stone Roses.(n)

programme.title: Joy of the Guitar Riff
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the impact of the guitar riff on popular music over the past 60 years, including a look at how it became the foundation on which rock 'n' roll was built. With stories from Brian May, Dave Davies, Hank Marvin, Joan Jett, Nile Rodgers, Tony Iommi, Robert Fripp, Johnny Marr and more. Narrated by Lauren Laverne.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Lost Waterlands: Escape to Swallows and Amazons Country
programme.desc: Presenters Dick Strawbridge and Professor Alice Roberts explore the British landscapes that inspired children's author Arthur Ransome to write his famous series Swallows and Amazons. Strawbridge uses vintage boats to investigate three iconic waterlands - the Lake District, the Norfolk broads, and the Suffolk coastline - while Roberts takes a look at the shore lines.(n)

programme.title: The Last Seabird Summer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following Adam Nicolson and the seabirds of the Shiants, a cluster of Scottish islands in the Outer Hebrides. As the puffins, guillemots and razorbills arrive from far out in the North Atlantic, Adam traces people's long history of dependence on seabirds - thousands of years of collecting eggs and hunting the birds for meat, oil and feathers.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: New series. An amnesiac is found disoriented on a highway, and when he is admitted to hospital, he learns his niece has disappeared. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Juan Elias' own partner Ricardo remains sceptical about his amnesia, and Eva tries to disassociates herself with the case. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Gary Davies introduce performances by Galaxy, the Weather Girls, Sade, Bananarama, Howard Jones, Tracey Ullman and Nena. First shown March 8, 1984.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Music compilation show celebrating some of the most popular boy bands to have graced TV screens since the 1960s. The programme highlights performances by acts defined by vocal harmonies, synchronised dance-steps and character appeal, including JLS, the Four Tops, the Monkees, Westlife, Village People and Blazin' Squad.(n)

programme.title: Premier League World
programme.desc: On this week's show, ex-Crystal Palace and Blackburn man Matt Jansen speaks candidly about his motorcycle accident. Plus, Jesper Blomqvist reveals his passion for ballroom dancing.(n)

programme.title: Hockey
programme.desc: Ireland and Egypt clash in Pool B of the Men's Hockey World League semi-finals in Johannesburg, South Africa.(n)

programme.title: Hockey

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: This 30 for 30 Shorts documentary delves into perhaps one of the most important, but least known, feats of Muhammad Ali's remarkable life, his intervention in Iraq in 1990.(n)

programme.title: Live Betfred Cup
programme.desc: Local rivals Ayr United and Kilmarnock clash in the group stage of the 2017 Betfred Cup at Somerset Park. It is Lee McCulloch's first competitive match in charge of the visitors.(n)

programme.title: UFC Breakdown
programme.desc: All the news and build-up ahead of UFC Fight Night in Glasgow as Gunnar Nelson and Santiago Ponzinibbio meet in a huge welterweight showdown.(n)

programme.title: UFC Greatest Fights
programme.desc: We revisit the classic featherweight championship bout between Jose Aldo and Chad Mendes at UFC 142 at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.(n)

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: We look back at this classic bantamweight clash between Cody Garbrandt and Dominick Cruz at UFC 207 at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada.(n)

programme.title: Live MLB
programme.desc: Major League Baseball action as the Boston Red Sox host fierce rivals the New York Yankees at Fenway Park.(n)

programme.title: MLB's Best
