programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George and Grandpa Pig watch motor racing on the TV together.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig gets left behind when his family has a picnic by the riverside.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly attends school for the first time, and Ben decides to come along too, despite warnings from the Wise Old Elf.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Crime-fighting capers with the heroes in a half-shell.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Pets Make You Laugh Out Loud 2.
programme.desc: Dave Spikey and Ellie Taylor introduce a compilation of animal antics, turning the spotlight on the high jinks of pets of all shapes and sizes, with resident animal behaviourist Professor Peter Neville on hand to explain the science behind the comical clips. Among this week's selection are greedy pigs, terrifying tortoises and Einstein, the American parrot with a talent for stand-up comedy. The pair also provide an update on the latest exploits of Hawkeye and Mutley, the cat-and-dog duo united by their shared love of scuba-diving.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Barry Peach outsmarts a disqualified driver, handler Jon Peacock takes his new sniffer dog Jack to carry out a drugs warrant, Carl Warrener makes a jaw-dropping discovery when he pulls a car over in the early hours and Brian Conville gets mobbed when he deals with a reckless learner driver.(n)

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras follow 51-year-old Graham, entertainments manager of the popular Villamar campsite in Benidorm, who longs to be with his girlfriend Jackie 2,000 miles away in Northern Ireland. There's also a profile of Scouse singer Eddie who is trying to crack Benidorm's entertainment scene, and Amanda from Essex who makes her living selling and renting Benidorm apartments.(n)

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: The observational documentary series exploring the lives of British ex-pats in Benidorm continues, as businesswoman Vikki decides to tempt her UK-based clients into embracing the Spanish lifestyle more vigorously with a `Spanish Day' at her salon. Meanwhile, a bad break-up for 21-year-old Ben, who runs the resort's only British-owned mobility scooter business, prompts his dad Mick to fly in to provide some much-needed perspective. Plus, the show provides an insight into the world of twin sisters Catherine and Patricia, expert scrimpers who keep meticulous records of their expenditure, once managing to drop their weekly outlay to just one euro.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary following the plight of Warren and Sheree Smith and the problems they face with next door neighbour Harry Street. Single dad Steve Foster, and Rachel Ayre are among the residents who also reveal their issues with locals.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: Highlights recalling the most shocking cases from the show's history, including a man who set up a car scrapyard on his driveway, to the annoyance of Mr Barker's neighbours, Barry and Phyllis. Cameras also follow Emma, a student who complained about a loud TV, and was beset by six months of intimidation and harassment.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Steve discover a locked wooden case when they are called to evict tenants from a flat in London's Docklands. Opening it up, they realise they urgently need police back-up - and the property quickly becomes a crime scene. Brian and Graham head to Swindon Town FC to collect a debt, while Paul's team arrives at a property in Essex to find that they have to remove a woman and her six children.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul, Steve and Ben make a shocking discovery when they break into a home in Essex while serving an eviction notice on a single mother and her two children. Meanwhile, Stewart and Iain receive more than just threats from the staff and owner of a taxi business, a car dealer has to choose between paying up or losing his showroom stars, and an Indian restaurant owner is in danger of losing his livelihood.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul Bohill and Steve and Ben Pinner face their biggest eviction yet - taking on squatters in a large central London office block. With the help of the police, they try to remove a suspected group of 70 from the building, but with a barricade in place, the team faces a challenging operation ahead. Elsewhere, officers are confronted by an army of family and friends when they attempt to enforce a writ at the property of a debtor, and face a difficult eviction at the north London home of a heavily pregnant tenant and her family, after the council fails to pay the rent to the landlord.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: Second Test Day Two.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the second day's play in the Second Test of the four-match series, which took place at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. With commentary by Graeme Smith, Geoffrey Boycott, Simon Hughes, Michael Vaughan and Mark Nicholas.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady plays cupid for 50-year-old Bournemouth Post Office manager Gary, who claims his loud shirts help him stand out from the crowd. Also seeking love is student Amy from Leeds, who works in a pub, and is nicknamed `Dolly Daydream' by the punters due to her mind's tendency to wander. Both are given a chance to quiz their three potential sweethearts, before choosing one to spend more time with. Plus, Paul catches up with last week's couples.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat, as well as reactions to the latest eviction. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E
programme.sub-title: FIA Formula E: New York: 2017 New York ePrix: Race One.
programme.desc: The first New York ePrix race. Action from the first of two races staged at the Brooklyn Street Circuit in New York, which served as the ninth round of the season.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Nick Wallis joins police forces across the country to reveal how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions against shoplifters.(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: Frank Morrison watches helplessly as smooth but creepy Rick Barnes wins his ex-wife and son. Danny's a troubled kid who tends to lie, but Frank takes his suspicions seriously. Has Barnes really committed murder? Tense thriller(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk. An affectionate homage to the 'creature features' of the 50s(n)

programme.title: The Second Arrival
programme.desc: In this sci-fi adventure, a brave hero saves the Blue Planet from alien invaders and in so doing keeps a promise to his dead brother(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage discovers that it's a wonderful life in this touching comic fantasy. He plays a rich, ruthless businessman who's shown the life he might have had by a guardian angel (Don Cheadle) who transforms him into a suburban working stiff with a wife (Tea Leoni), kids and minivan. Brett Ratner directed. Jeremy Piven, Saul Rubinek, Josef Sommer, Makenzie Vega(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: A cocky marketing student works in a bar to get by, but falls under the tutelage of an older barman, who encourages him to live a selfish, hedonistic lifestyle(n)

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Madonna stars in husband Guy Ritchie's remake of this classic about a bored socialite who's stranded on an island with a rude and bullying sailor(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer (Angelina Jolie-Pitt) and her writer husband (Brad Pitt) attempt to rebuild their crumbling marriage by taking an extended vacation to a small coastal town, where they bond with its quirky inhabitants. As he struggles with writer's block and she with her emotional turmoil stemming from their troubled relationship, they try to remember what brought them together fourteen years prior. This film marks the first time in ten years that Angelina Jolie-Pitt and Brad Pitt have starred together, since the 2005 film Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Jolie-Pitt is also the writer and director of the film(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A mousy college freshman living on her own in New York City meets Brooke, her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: After being left at the altar, a singer tries to piece his life back together with a waitress in this romantic comedy set in 1985(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: Will Ferrell, Woody Harrelson and André Benjamin star in Kent Alterman's sports comedy. Jackie Moon is a musician whose sole chart success earns him enough to buy a professional basketball team. It's 1976 and Moon's team, the Tropics, plays in the American Basketball Association, which is about to merge with the National Basketball Association. But only four teams from the ABA will survive the merger, and Moon is determined not to be left owning a defunct team. As well as earning enough points, they also have to attract at least 2000 fans to each home game, so Moon stages a series of desperate publicity stunts, from the astute to the gloriously insane (and, while this is a loose retelling of the ABA/NBA story, some of these stunts actually happened). Can Moon, his back-from-retirement signing Monix and self-centred but promising youngster Clarence ensure the Tropics' survival?(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: On the verge of getting married, real estate agent Peter Klaven realises he doesn't have any close pals. Setting out to find a best man, he befriends amiable slacker Sydney Fife, but spends so much time with his new buddy that the wedding is put in jeopardy. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: In this irreverent spin on the superhero genre, mercenary Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) agrees to participate in a top-secret experiment after learning that he has terminal cancer. When the procedure leaves him with advanced healing powers and a disfigured face, he reinvents himself as a wisecracking, spandex-clad antihero known as Deadpool, and seeks revenge on those responsible. Morena Baccarin, Ed Skrein, T.J. Miller, and Gina Carano co-star. Directed by Tim Miller(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: Apocalyptic thriller. Military scientist Robert Neville is the lone survivor of a medical catastrophe that has wiped out most of the population of New York. For years he has sent out daily radio messages in the hope that there is someone else alive in the ruined city. Unfortunately for Neville, the only people still in New York are the mutant victims of the virus. As they haunt the shadows waiting for him to make a wrong move, Neville's only hope is to develop a cure using his own immune blood(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien from another planet, accompanied by a giant robot, lands on Earth to eradicate the human race because of environmental damage inflicted by mankind on the planet. Keanu Reeves stars in this spectacular update of the 1951 sci-fi classic. Jennifer Connelly, Jaden Smith, Kathy Bates, Jon Hamm. Directed by Scott Derrickson(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Based on the true story of the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig, which caused an oil spill. The worst U.S. oil spill disaster in history(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: Ultraviolent gangster epic from Brian De Palma. Al Pacino is the ambitious Cuban immigrant who builds a drug empire. Strong language/violence/drugs/flashing images(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Fast-paced action comedy in which a dowdy romantic-adventure writer is hurled into a real-life adventure in the Colombian jungle in order to save her sister, who will be killed if a treasure map is not delivered to her captors. She is helped out by a brash mercenary, and together they search for the priceless gem located in the map. A non-stop mix of thrills, laughter and romance with energetic performances all round(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: Chris Rock directed, co-wrote and stars in this hilarious farce about an obscure politician whose campaign for president surprisingly gains momentum. He plays Mays Gilliam, a dedicated D.C. alderman, who astonishes his detractors when his folksy campaign catches fire(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote and directed this delightful romantic comedy, reminiscent of his Oscar winner, "Annie Hall." Jason Biggs stars as a hapless writer frustrated by his very appealing, very neurotic girlfriend (Christina Ricci). Allen also costars as Biggs' mentor. Danny DeVito, Stockard Channing, Fisher Stevens, David Conrad, Jimmy Fallon(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: Siblings (Christina Ricci, Jesse Eisenberg) are bitten by a beast in Los Angeles, then gradually turn into werewolves(n)

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: When a computer whizz-kid taps into the government early-warning system, it invites him to play Global Thermonuclear Warfare. Little does he realise that this is not a variation on Space Invaders, and his gleeful decision to nuke Las Vegas precipitates a full-scale countdown to Armageddon..(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A young woman (Teresa Palmer) must protect her brother (Gabriel Bateman) from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother (Maria Bello), who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana. Billy Burke and Alexander DiPersia co-star. Produced by James Wan (The Conjuring), Lights Out is a feature-length expansion of director David F. Sandberg's short film of the same name, which became a viral sensation online(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated in this tense sci-fi thriller. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Chain-smoking loner Constantine tries to buy his place in Heaven by banishing Earth-bound demons back to Hell. But his fate is tied up with Angela, a cop investigating the alleged suicide of her twin(n)

programme.title: Alien: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: The crew of a spacecraft fight off a terrifying extra-terrestrial invader in Ridley Scott's cut of his sci-fi classic(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Ripley awakens 57 years later in this sequel to 1979's "Alien," returning to the space colony where she first encountered a hideous, reptilian creature(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Warrant Officer Ellen Ripley crash-lands on a remote prison planet and must once again fight for her life against the deadly Alien creature(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: Science fiction horror. When a spaceship crash lands on an alien world, the crash survivors - including a ruthless killer and the bounty hunter who captured him - face a race against time to escape the planet when they discover the main inhabitants of this world are ravenous nocturnal monsters. With the planet basking in sunlight and the creatures only able to live in darkness, the survivors presume they are safe from harm until they discover that a rare total eclipse is imminent. Their very survival is reliant on them finding a way off the planet(n)

programme.desc: Frank Morrison watches helplessly as smooth but creepy Rick Barnes wins his ex-wife and son. Danny's a troubled kid who tends to lie, but Frank takes his suspicions seriously. Has Barnes really committed murder? Tense thriller(n)

programme.desc: Ilhan Omar. Minnesota state representative Ilhan Omar (DFL-60B)(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Krazy Kripples. When Christopher Reeve comes to town, Jimmy becomes offended because everyone pays attention to him(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Red Hot Catholic Love. A priest visits South Park to find out why church attendance is down; the boys protest the tinkering of their favorite movies(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Chef Aid. Chef (voice of Isaac Hayes) invites some of his well-known musician friends to participate in a benefit concert after he loses all of his money in a lawsuit. Meanwhile, the boys join the workforce to help him get out of debt(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Concussion Quarterback. Sketches include a concussed football player cheering his team on; a man accusing his wife of being unfaithful; and a restaurateur scaring away his customers(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Gang Stand-Off. Sketches include racist superheroes; gangsters' fondness for the "Twilight" franchise; and a place where names are spoken via intestinal gas(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Cool Vampires. Sketches include a creepy ghost as a roommate; men trying to find a silver lining in being tortured; and a meeting with a house full of sexy vampires(n)

programme.title: Veggie Bullet-Up Your Kitchen Game!
programme.desc: Spiralize, Shred, Slice, and Blend with Veggie Bullet!(n)

programme.title: Shark Rocket Complete with DuoClean Technology - For Floors & Carpets
programme.desc: World's first & only no loss of suction ultra-light upright vacuum, even more suction power than any Rocket before, advanced swivel steering, transforms to a portable vacuum, easily cleans drapes, under appliances, upholstery & car – still under $200(n)

programme.title: PiYo Workout!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Accidents Caught on Camera with HD Mirror Cam!
programme.desc: See crazy accidents caught on camera with the HD Mirror Cam - the most important tool you'll ever own for your car! HD Mirror Cam turns any rearview mirror into a dash cam, and captures it all so if anything ever happens you always have the proof!(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Our True Lies. One of the med students cheats on a test, so Dr. Cox punishes the entire class. Elsewhere, Denise makes a surprising admission(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Our Dear Leaders. Dr. Cox names Lucy team leader for hell week, but the young student takes her role a bit too seriously. Turk, meanwhile, battles insecurity when a renowned surgeon comes to town(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Our Driving Issues. Cole and Kelso realise true friends are hard to come by after the pair receive unsettling news following routine tests(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Our Thanks. The students gain new perspectives as their first semester wraps up in the Season 9 finale. Cole finds his true calling, while Drew reaches a personal milestone and Lucy receives career inspiration(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My First Day (Pilot). In the series pilot, J.D. encounters a take-charge nurse, finds romance and faces an anxious first night on call. J.D.: Zach Braff. Elliott: Sarah Chalke. Carla: Judy Reyes. Mr. Burski: Ted Rogers(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Mentor. J.D. has difficulty with a possible cancer patient and looks to Dr. Cox for guidance. Elliot clashes with the nurses(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Baby Don't You Do It. Brooke sees red when Kelso burns down the police academy; Pastor Dan provides premarital counseling to Eric and Donna(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Who Are You. Brooke Shields plays Jackie's mum, who's looking to smooth things over after her fling in Mexico; Kelso is hesitant about continuing police training(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: A Man With Money. Jackie and Donna try to prove their gold-digging suspicions about Pamela, who prompts pulsing in Red's heart monitor(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Happy Jack. Donna catches Eric in a compromising position in her bathroom. Kelso needs to be brought down a peg or two(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Do You Think It's Alright?. Eric tries desperately to avoid going on further shopping sprees with Donna. Kelso tries to invent something but all his ideas have already been thought of already(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Substitute. When the gang invite Mitch to join them he becomes obsessed with Donna(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Squeeze Box. Red and Hyde accidentally see Pamela topless; Donna learns Eric dated while they were broken up. Pamela: Brooke Shields. Mitch: Seth Green. Red: Kurtwood Smith. Hyde: Danny Masterson(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: 5:15. Donna agrees to be Mitch's date to his brother's wedding. Fez meets a beautiful girl(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Sparks. Chaos results when Eric sneaks a peek at Donna's wedding dress before the big day; Red needs to find a truly meaningful wedding gift for the couple(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Space Race: Part II. Conclusion of the Season 3 finale: Archer and his ISIS colleagues voyage to the final frontier to prevent a catastrophe aboard the International Space Station. They come to wish they hadn't(n)

programme.title: Archer

programme.title: The Dilemma
programme.desc: A man finds out that what you don't say to a friend is just as important as what you do is this story of how far you can bend a brotherly bond before it snaps. Since college, confirmed bachelor Ronny (Vaughn) and happily married Nick (James) have been through thick and thin. Now partners in an auto design firm, the two pals are vying to land a dream project that would launch their company. Ronny's girlfriend, Beth (Connelly), and Nick's wife, Geneva (Ryder), are by their sides. But Ronny's world is turned upside down when he inadvertently sees Geneva out with another man and makes it his mission to get answers. As the amateur investigation dissolves into mayhem, he learns that Nick has a few secrets of his own. Now, with the clock ticking and pressure mounting on the biggest presentation of their careers, Ronny must decide what will happen if he reveals the truth to his best friend(n)

programme.title: No Strings Attached
programme.desc: Lifelong friends Adam (Ashton Kutcher) and Emma (Natalie Portman) attempt to avoid falling in love after falling into each other's beds in this comedy exploring the complexities and quirks of having friends with benefits. Adam was a typical, hormonal 14-year-old when he first came on to Emma at summer camp -- and got shot down in flames. In the years that followed, however, Adam and Emma continued to cross paths until, eventually, they both caved to their animal instincts. Despite an intense session of earth-shaking sex, however, Emma makes it clear to Adam that the last thing she wants is a committed relationship. And thanks to the fact that Adam's father (Kevin Kline), a fallen television star, has just begun dating his son's ex-girlfriend, the horrified bachelor has developed an aversion to monogamy as well. At first their casual stance on sex works great for both; Emma can focus on her career instead of allowing her emotions to dictate her decisions, and Adam can play the field without fear of hurting her feelings. Over time, though, a funny thing happens -- Adam begins to develop feelings for Emma that he never had for any of his countless conquests. Before they both know it, love has reared its ugly head and they've gotten too emotionally involved to cut the relationship off cold. But is commitment in the cards for the couple that always swore it would never get serious, or has the time come for them to finally part ways once and for all?(n)

programme.title: Wild France
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring thousands of years of history, landscape and nature in France, as well as thriving wildlife from the Alps to the Pyrenees, as well as venturing from the mainland to Corsica.(n)

programme.title: Secret Life Underground
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary making use of cutting-edge technology to explore the rich biodiversity of soil, revealing why what lies beneath the surface is not just a simple eco-system, but actually a living organism in which countless creatures exist in a state of inter-dependence.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: During a visit to America's eastern seaboard, the actor hunts for shark and bluefin tuna in the North Atlantic, before joining local fisherman Jim Ryan on his trawler to look for Massachusetts lobster. He is then forced to travel hundreds of miles south to pursue his goal of catching striped bass, and finally heads to Niagara Falls in search of the steelhead fighting fish.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.(n)

programme.title: Wild France
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring thousands of years of history, landscape and nature in France, as well as thriving wildlife from the Alps to the Pyrenees, as well as venturing from the mainland to Corsica.(n)

programme.title: Wild Caribbean
programme.desc: The region's mysterious side comes to light during a journey from the rainforests of Panama to the Barrier Reef of the Americas - the world's second largest coral system. The programme also explores the wildlife on the shores of Central America, including killer whales and thimble jellyfish in the deep waters near Honduras. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Combining remarkable demonstrations of abilities with revealing photography, Chris Packham travels the world to uncover the secrets of animals' intelligence, emotions and self-awareness. The first episode explores the remarkable ways creatures use their senses, examining how dogs' powerful ability to detect smell creates a bizarre alternative reality for them.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham continues his exploration of the minds of the cleverest animals on the planet by examining the problem-solving abilities of crows. He also investigates the extraordinary range of animal intelligence, examining bees that navigate, cockatoos that can pick locks and an ingenious octopus.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines why the most intelligent animals on the planet are also the most social. Swimming with a pod of dolphins in the Bahamas, he explores their language and learns how they are able to recognise themselves in a mirror. He also witnesses the deviousness of chimpanzees and watches elephants as they mourn their dead. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Broadcaster Clare Balding and vet Steve Leonard travel the world to watch vets perform innovative life-saving operations on a variety of wild animals. This first edition features a baby panda called Zhu Xia in south-west China that needs an MRI scan, and rescued gorilla Shufai in Cameroon, who was shot by poachers when he was a baby. Plus, a manta ray on the Japanese island of Okinawa that needs an ultra-sound scan to determine if it's pregnant, and a four-ton elephant in Laos with a gunshot wound.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to Japan where she visits inventor and vet Dr Keiichi Ueda. The vet has dedicated the past 12 years of his career to helping a dolphin called Fuji who has no tail as a result of a bacterial infection and he is hoping that a new prosthetic tail will enable her to swim properly again. Steve Leonard heads to the rainforest of Laos, where Edinburgh Zoo vet Romain Pizzi is undertaking keyhole surgery on a endangered moon bear called Champa who suffers from excess fluid on her brain. Steve then visits Florida where reptile specialist Doug Mader is using the latest technology to save Martha, an alligator with a badly blocked gut. Clare and Steve also follow the stories of a Galapagos tortoise with a mystery illness, a five-ton elephant suffering from an infected tusk and a tiger that keeps having nose bleeds.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Combining remarkable demonstrations of abilities with revealing photography, Chris Packham travels the world to uncover the secrets of animals' intelligence, emotions and self-awareness. The first episode explores the remarkable ways creatures use their senses, examining how dogs' powerful ability to detect smell creates a bizarre alternative reality for them.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham continues his exploration of the minds of the cleverest animals on the planet by examining the problem-solving abilities of crows. He also investigates the extraordinary range of animal intelligence, examining bees that navigate, cockatoos that can pick locks and an ingenious octopus.(n)

programme.desc: A wealthy tycoon whose life is orderly and happy finds his household disrupted by the arrival of a young man called Joe Black. His daughter falls for the young man innocent of the fact that Joe is Death, visiting Earth to take the life of her father..(n)

programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: Ice Cube co-wrote and stars in this second sequel to the 1995 comedy "Friday," which once again follows a day in the life of two cousins in Los Angeles. This time, Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) are robbed by Santa Claus on Christmas Eve, and the not-so-jolly old elf has made off with their rent money. John Witherspoon, Bebe Drake(n)

programme.title: Wet Hot American Summer
programme.desc: 1980s teen comedies finally get the parody they so richly deserve with Wet Hot American Summer, the first feature film from writer/director David Wain and co-screenwriter Michael Showalter, formerly of the sketch comedy troupe the State. It's the last day of the summer season at Camp Firewood, and as camp director Beth (Janeane Garofalo) prepares to wrap things up, the staff of teenage counselors realize this is their last chance to do something about the summer romances that have been brewing for the past three months. Sweet but shy Coop (Michael Showalter) is crazy about pretty Katie (Marguerite Moreau), but there's the problem of her severely moody boyfriend Andy (Paul Rudd). Meanwhile, Victor (Ken Marino) is trying to score with sexy Abby (Marisa Ryan), who is known to make friends easily, and McKinley (Michael Ian Black) and Ben (Bradley Cooper) attempt to keep their hot and heavy relationship a secret. Meanwhile, arts and crafts teacher Gail (Molly Shannon) turns to her students for comfort as her marriage falls apart, drama coach Susie (Amy Poehler) tries to whip the talent show into shape with Ben's help, and camp chef Gene (Christopher Meloni) deals with his unique sexual quirks with the help of a talking can of vegetables (voiced by H. Jon Benjamin). Beth even finds time for romance with socially inept astrophysicist Henry (David Hyde Pierce), but first Henry has to save Camp Firewood from a large piece of space junk about to re-enter Earth's atmosphere. Like Wain and Showalter, Ken Marino, Michael Ian Black, and Joe Lo Truglio (who appears in a small role) were also members of the State; fellow State alumnus Kerri Kenney was cast in a supporting role in the film, but her character didn't appear in the final cut(n)

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: After this stunning opening, the action switches to the Himalayas, where tycoon Elliott Vaughn has financed an expedition that will take him to the summit of K2-the world's second highest mountain. Annie is one of Elliott's party. In the face of a threatening storm, Elliott recklessly insists the climb should continue. The storm duly arrives and decimates the expedition, leaving Elliott and Annie stranded. Peter leads a group of climbers-including the grizzled Montgomery Wick and a French-Canadian nurse in a rescue attempt(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Fast-paced action thriller in which a young family on a white-water rafting adventure in Montana are taken hostage by a pair of dangerous fugitives. The rafting holiday - a birthday gift for the New England couple's ten-year-old son - turns into a nightmare when the two armed killers take control and try to force the mother, a proficient rafter, to use her skills to help them to escape down the treacherous rapids(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Profile of military genius Gen. George S. Patton and chronicles his World War II campaigns on the European front and in North Africa, and his push into Germany(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: The mysterious fifth element when combined with four others creates the ultimate weapon against universal evil. The story begins in 1914 when benign aliens visit an ancient Egyptian temple to steal four stones containing information about this mysterious element. The visitors promise to return to Earth in the future to save it from evil. Three centuries pass and Earth is threatened by a thunderous Cosmic Evil. Unfortunately, the Evil killed the Good aliens who promised to save the planet. Fortunately, Earthlings have a piece of one of the alien saviors. Utilizing DNA restructuring, scientists grow the piece into a perfect new alien which takes the form of a curvaceous, seductive no-holds barred redheaded acrobat who escapes from the lab with the police in hot pursuit. Desperately she dives into a cab reluctantly driven by luckless former special force officer (Bruce Willis) who suddenly finds himself faced with the task of saving the universe by finding the missing stones and vanquishing the evil forces. Featuring dazzling special effects and classy production values coupled with a healthy splash of outlandish high fashion the emphasis of Besson's film is not so much plot as it is over-the top spectacle(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A wealthy man who had cancer is found murdered, despite only having weeks left to live, leaving the team suspecting one of his relatives could be to blame. Jane discovers his son was being cut out of the will and his wife was pretending to be ill in a con to win the affections of rich men. He is also led to a charlatan healer selling a special kind of tea after noticing an unusual smell on the body. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A casino security guard is killed and the team investigates his place of work, leading Jane to meet a magician he used to work with. He discovers his former colleague is planning to rob the business because his girlfriend has been kidnapped, and sets up a daring robbery as part of a live show in the hope of learning the murderer's identity. Crime drama, guest starring Christopher Judge, with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A popular teacher is found murdered and the team discovers hate mail in his bag. However, as the investigation gets under way, the agents discover the victim's behaviour had always been immaculate, ruling out any wrongdoing when traces of drugs are found in his car and a pupil accuses him of sleeping with a prostitute. Jane focuses on the relationship between the director of the school play and the lead actor, and even performs as an understudy to unravel more details about the crime. Starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Female impersonators come under suspicion when a man is found burnt to death on a cabaret bar's doorstep, but as Jane and the team investigate, they discover the victim was being bullied by more than one person, forcing them to try to lure the killer into the open. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A boy blames himself for the death of his friend, forcing Brenda to tread lightly to get to the bottom of the case. To make matters worse, the deceased child's mother makes accusations of her own. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The detectives deal with a case of mistaken identity, which is hampering a major investigation. Meanwhile, Brenda is called to testify in Pope's divorce settlement, but finds that both her career and reputation are at risk. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda races to the scene of three murders, but when she arrives the bodies are nowhere to be found. To solve the case, the team must first locate the victims before the hunt for the killer can begin. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the death of a teenager who was due to appear in court to testify that a man convicted of murdering a Korean couple was not actually the culprit. However, several unexpected twists in the case make her wonder whether the boy was really going to tell the truth. Meanwhile, disaster strikes when Pope's ex-wife exposes one of his past relationships. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the disappearance of photographer Martin Roe, who was due to testify at an army first lieutenant's court-martial after he captured a picture of what appeared to be a soldier killing an unarmed civilian. However, the photograph is leaked, and Roe is later found dead with a needle in his arm.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Return of the American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service. Gibbs and McGee travel to Russia to escort a computer expert connected to classified intel. However, the mission is compromised and they are forced to go off the grid while being hunted by Russian mercenaries. Meanwhile, the team in DC frantically tries to locate the missing pair. programme.title: American Dad

programme.desc: Stan is given pills by a colleague that enable him to stay awake all night so he can spend more time enjoying his hobbies, but when Francine discovers his nocturnal activities, she wants to join him. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger try to write a script for a pornographic film.(n)

programme.desc: The Smiths plan a game night and Roger makes excuses about other engagements - until he is caught out by his lies and has to admit that he has been spending time with another family.(n)

programme.desc: A bomb detonates at a military charity concert, killing two men. programme.desc: Part one of two. Gibbs joins forces with the FBI when the body of a congressman and former agent washes ashore in New Orleans. programme.desc: A US Marine sergeant falls to her death from a building, and when Gibbs and his team examine the circumstances, the woman's doctor urges him to consider this a murder investigation.(n)

Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A top secret device goes missing, and the bungling spy is teamed up with a brash American agent to recover it.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Drummond needs Piglet's help to prevent MI6 being merged with MI5.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin suspects Paul will try to sabotage his vicars and tarts party. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Peter Egan and Penelope Wilton. First broadcast February 26, 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following a spate of thefts, Gordon hides in the ladies' changing room in a bid to catch whoever is responsible. A stressed Helen urges Gordon to accompany her to the doctor, so he tasks Colin with replacing him on surveillance duties. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?.
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny hears a voice from above, and decides he must wait patiently for more information, leaving the gang to make sure he is well-equipped to receive messages. Comedian Bobby Ball returns as the gullible pickle factory worker, with Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Oh Look! Mitzi's Found Her Mummy.
programme.desc: Clegg takes care of a friendly dog for the day, but when Truly, Billy and Alvin visit, the canine ferociously guards his new minder's house, leaving the gang to spend a day on the doorstep thinking up ambitious plans to negotiate their entry. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine rockets to stardom following an appearance on Terry Wogan's radio show, but finds fame something of a bugbear. Meanwhile, the Dibley Gala organisers prepare for a knockout performance. Guest starring former ballerina Darcey Bussell, with Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?.
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny hears a voice from above, and decides he must wait patiently for more information, leaving the gang to make sure he is well-equipped to receive messages. Comedian Bobby Ball returns as the gullible pickle factory worker, with Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Oh Look! Mitzi's Found Her Mummy.
programme.desc: Clegg takes care of a friendly dog for the day, but when Truly, Billy and Alvin visit, the canine ferociously guards his new minder's house, leaving the gang to spend a day on the doorstep thinking up ambitious plans to negotiate their entry. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil decides to enhance the hotel's reputation with an exclusive night of gourmet cuisine. His new chef has a cordon bleu rating and loves every type of dish - but he is particularly taken with Manuel. Classic comedy, written by and starring John Cleese and Connie Booth. First broadcast in 1975.(n)

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: The job centre's new manager embarks on a quest to find Frank a job suited to his talents, despite the staff's long experience of failure. Comedy, starring Michael Crawford, Michele Dotrice and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: The installation of a hi-tech security system sounds like just the thing to protect the shop - but it is not long before Manny gets trapped inside, leaving Bernard out in the cold. Fortunately, things go a little better for Fran, who is reunited with an old flame. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, guest starring Nick Frost and Peter Serafinowicz.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes looks after a robotic baby that has been given to Dermot and Maria to help them prepare for their new arrival, but uses unorthodox methods to stop the fake infant from crying. Meanwhile, Cathy develops a crush on her psychology lecturer. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes gets the wrong end of the stick and fears her relatives are planning to send her to a nursing home. Furious, she sets out to persuade them she is not going senile - unaware it is actually Spartacus the dog who is set to be sent away. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie prepares for his birthday celebration - but suffers an accident while putting up the decorations and breaks his leg. Only Eddie's mates Spudgun and Dave Hedgehog show up at the party and it dawns on Richie that he has no real friends. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayell and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The boys join Mrs Lineker's Love Bureau hoping to find their perfect love matches. Richie's video tells the potential suitors that he is, in fact, a duke and this secures him a date with a countess from Moldavia. Undeterred, he invites her to his place and arranges for Eddie to pretend to be his butler for the evening. Chaotic comedy, written by and starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Marsha seeks a new lodger when Amber moves out. Brian suffers a creative block, while Tim and Daisy face a vocational crisis after a visit to the job centre. Comedy, starring Jessica Hynes and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Mike and Tim enter Robot Wars, but a saboteur threatens their chances. Meanwhile, Daisy gets a job in a kitchen and Brian faces the terrifying prospect of exhibiting his work in public. Guest starring Reece Shearsmith (Psychoville) and Joanna Scanlan (Getting On).(n)

programme.title: Bill Hicks - One Night Stand
programme.desc: A 1991 performance by outspoken American comedian Bill Hicks recorded at Chicago's Vic Theatre, featuring his views on smoking, drinking, drugs and advertising.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows
programme.desc: Comedian Armando Iannucci explores themes of reality and, after getting caught up in an on-line bank raid and encountering a man who is literally being bored to death, reaches the conclusion that most people do not take it seriously any more. Elsewhere, while everyone's busy trying to avoid hearing the truth about themselves, a tornado special effect walks out on a disaster movie.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel - but he cannot stop thinking about his business. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The next two semi-finalists work a shift at the Michelin-starred Latymer restaurant in the Pennyhill Park Hotel in Bagshot, Surrey. The pair must recreate head chef Michael Wignall's signature dish of quail breast with confit quail leg, braised tongue, sweetbreads and cockscomb in a port glaze. They then draw on what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Gregg Wallace, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The pressure continues to rise as the contestants' pudding-making skills face a stern examination. Their first task involves creating a pair of sponge dishes, before Mary Berry sets the latest technical challenge - recreating her recipe for the meringue-topped dessert queen of puddings. Finally the cooks try to get to grips with the intricacies of baking strudel in the showstopper round - before one of them leaves the competition for good. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It's the final episode of knockout week and the remaining eight hopefuls are all desperate to stay in the competition. There is just one challenge today - to create an unforgettable `showstopper' dish that will wow judges Gregg Wallace and John Torode and secure six of the cooks a place in the semi-finals. But they only have 90 minutes to create their masterpiece - so the race is on.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin returns to the restaurant where he made his name, the Hotel Du Vin in Winchester, and visits one of the most popular chocolatiers in the country, William Curley, who demonstrates why Japanese dessert cooking is currently flourishing. Afterwards, he travels to the Lake District, where a restaurant regularly puts on a menu exclusively devoted to puddings.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nation's love affair with beer and cider, revealing how at one time it was safer to drink ale than water. The duo are also given a chance to gain hands-on brewing experience at a cider festival.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the state of Rajasthan, a land of palaces and hilltop forts, where he cooks a biryani fit for a royal banquet. He then heads north to the mountainous region of Himachal Pradesh, and joins local nobility at a gathering in their home village and has an audience with the Dalai Lama.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef prepares a Thai feast as he extends his stay in Melbourne, before heading down the coast to source fresh mussels and hold a dinner party.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: A visit to a famous fish restaurant in Whitby to talk about local specialities is followed up by the chef cooking pan-fried halibut with peas, horseradish and crispy pancetta bacon.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a cost-saving Mexican chilli featuring the much under-rated shin of beef, reveals the secrets of his home-made chapatis with aubergine dhal and shares two ideas for using up leftover chicken from the Sunday roast. Plus, a frugal twist on a favourite pasta dish.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver proves that frozen fish can be just as good as fresh with his recipe for tikka curry, demonstrates a spin on the much-loved cheese and beans combo with smoky barbecue baked beans and sweet potatoes, and shows how to make hoi sin chicken wraps for just £1.69 a head. Plus, two midweek ideas to transform roast beef leftovers - a Moroccan-inspired tagine and a hot and spicy noodle soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates a fresh spin on a fast-food favourite, preparing a bucket of fried chicken with rainbow slaw, sweet sticky potato wedges and charred corn on the cob, and he makes enough to feed a family of four for less than £10. The chef also shares tips on getting crispy chicken skin without having to deep-fry, and rustles up spiced sausage bake, garlic bread and a meat-free roast, as well as two very different recipes for leftover salmon.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a thrifty curry using chicken drumsticks bought for half the price of breast, but full of flavour. He also makes a Mexican omelette with a guacamole-style slaw, a giant vegetable rosti with poached eggs and crispy Cajun fishcakes, and `snake in the hole', a cross between a roasted meatloaf and meatballs with Yorkshire pudding.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef samples Mediterranean food and visits his favourite places in the region. In the first programme he catches a ferry to the mountainous island of Corsica, where he tastes sausages and sheep's cheese, and discovers the locals have a passion for chestnuts.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef continues to explore his favourite locations in the Mediterranean, visiting a lagoon in Sardinia where he watches fishermen catching mullet using ancient Roman methods. He also boards a ferry heading for the city of Palermo in Sicily and discovers one of the most impressive pasta dishes of his career.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef experiences the bustling and colourful fish market in the Sicilian city of Catania and discovers dishes developed through centuries of poverty in Puglia on Italy's mainland. However, he is shocked to wake up one morning to find his vehicle is missing.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates a fresh spin on a fast-food favourite, preparing a bucket of fried chicken with rainbow slaw, sweet sticky potato wedges and charred corn on the cob, and he makes enough to feed a family of four for less than £10. programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: Evicted. In the second-season finale, Bret and Jemaine are forced to move in with Mel and Doug when they can't afford to pay their rent, and Murray sees dollar signs in a theatrical production about the band(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Citizen U.S.A.: A 50 State Road Trip
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi's patriotic travelogue crisscrosses the U.S. to attend naturalization ceremonies in all 50 states and listens to recent immigrants from around the world explain their decision to become American citizens. The film is inspired by the naturalization process experienced by Pelosi's Dutch-born husband, Michiel Vos, and includes remarks by former secretaries of state Madeleine Albright and Henry Kissinger, commentator Arianna Huffington, and rock star Gene Simmons(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie stars as sexy Lara Croft in this high-tech action fantasy, based on the popular video game. The aristocratic adventuress battles a villainous secret society as she races to recover an ancient artifact with magic powers. Jolie's real-life father, Jon Voight, costars as Lara's dad, Lord Richard Croft. Iain Glen, Daniel Craig, Noah Taylor(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Barry Sonnenfeld directs this kissing cousin of his own 1995 hit Get Shorty, a comic caper adapted by Robert Ramsey and Matthew Stone from the novel by newspaper humorist Dave Barry. When two New Jersey hitmen (Dennis Farina and Jack Kehler) show up in Miami to whack crooked businessman Arthur Herk (Stanley Tucci), they happen to creep into his backyard at the same time as Matt (Ben Foster), a high school kid with his own assassination plans. Only, Matt plans to use nothing heavier than a squirt gun on Jenny (Zooey Deschanel), Arthur's daughter, as part of a school-wide game of "killer." When the plans collide, mayhem ensues, and Matt's struggling ex-columnist dad (Tim Allen, loosely modeled on Barry), Arthur's bored wife (Rene Russo), and two confused police officers (Janeane Garofalo and Patrick Warburton) are also called to the scene. Shift to the next day and there's more craziness to follow. Two dimwitted petty criminals (Tom Sizemore and Johnny Knoxville) choose the exact moment Arthur is transacting a nuclear arms deal to hold up the dive bar where they're regulars, which is actually a front for the Russian mob. Soon the whole motley cast -- including an agreeable drifter (Jason Lee), a buxom maid (Sofia Vergara), and a pair of ruthless FBI agents (Heavy D and Omar Epps) -- are caught up in a hostage scenario in which the weapon accidentally gets brought aboard a hijacked plan(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: A man found wandering at New York Central Station is taken into psychiatric care because he claims to be Prot from the planet K-PAX, "1,000 of your light years away". Psychiatrist Dr. Mark Powell doesn't believe him and tries to unlock the trauma, but as Prot reveals knowledge that only a handful of astronomers could know and shows an uncanny knack for helping his fellow patients heal, even Powell begins to wonder. Then clues that Prot lets slip under hypnosis lead Powell to a more earthly explanation, or so he thinks, in Iain Softley's assured, gripping sci-fi fantasy(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A parody of the much-done medieval English tale of Robin Hood and his Merry Men, ROBIN HOOD: MEN IN TIGHTS also directly lampoons the politically correct ROBIN HOOD: PRINCE OF THIEVES, which starred the hearthrob of the time, the very un-British Kevin Costner. English hearthrob Cary Elwes gets a turn in the role of the hero of Sherwood Forest who robs from the rich to give to the poor when he returns from the Crusades to find his beloved King Richard usurped by the evil Prince John..(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt takes on a renegade spy who's stolen a deadly high-tech virus(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Power to the President. Isobel Yeung reports from Turkey as citizens head to the polls in a nationwide referendum that grants President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan unprecedented power(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: 300's Zack Snyder brings Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' critically acclaimed comic book Watchmen to the big screen, courtesy of DC Comics and Warner Bros. Pictures. Set in an alternate universe circa 1985, the film's world is a highly unstable one where a nuclear war is imminent between America and Russia. Superheroes have long been made to hang up their tights thanks to the government-sponsored Keene Act, but that all changes with the death of The Comedian (Jeffrey Dean Morgan), a robust ex-hero commando whose mysterious free fall out a window perks the interest of one of the country's last remaining vigilantes, Rorschach (Jackie Earle Haley). His investigation leads him to caution many of his other former costumed colleagues, including Dr. Manhattan, Night Owl (Patrick Wilson), Ozymandias (Matthew Goode), Sally Jupiter (Carla Gugino), and her daughter, The Silk Spectre (Malin Akerman). Heralded for bringing the world of superheroes into the literary world, Watchmen gave the super-powered mythos a real-life grounding that had been missing in mainstream comics to that point. The film adaptation had languished in one form of development hell or another for years after the book's release, with various directors on and off the project, including Terry Gilliam, David Hayter, and Darren Aronofsky, as well as Paul Greengrass, whose eventual dismissal stemmed from budget conflicts with the studio(n)

programme.title: Vice

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: Evicted. In the second-season finale, Bret and Jemaine are forced to move in with Mel and Doug when they can't afford to pay their rent, and Murray sees dollar signs in a theatrical production about the band(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.title: To Be Announced
programme.desc: To be announced(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Citizen U.S.A.: A 50 State Road Trip
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi's patriotic travelogue crisscrosses the U.S. to attend naturalization ceremonies in all 50 states and listens to recent immigrants from around the world explain their decision to become American citizens. The film is inspired by the naturalization process experienced by Pelosi's Dutch-born husband, Michiel Vos, and includes remarks by former secretaries of state Madeleine Albright and Henry Kissinger, commentator Arianna Huffington, and rock star Gene Simmons(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie stars as sexy Lara Croft in this high-tech action fantasy, based on the popular video game. The aristocratic adventuress battles a villainous secret society as she races to recover an ancient artifact with magic powers. Jolie's real-life father, Jon Voight, costars as Lara's dad, Lord Richard Croft. Iain Glen, Daniel Craig, Noah Taylor(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Barry Sonnenfeld directs this kissing cousin of his own 1995 hit Get Shorty, a comic caper adapted by Robert Ramsey and Matthew Stone from the novel by newspaper humorist Dave Barry. When two New Jersey hitmen (Dennis Farina and Jack Kehler) show up in Miami to whack crooked businessman Arthur Herk (Stanley Tucci), they happen to creep into his backyard at the same time as Matt (Ben Foster), a high school kid with his own assassination plans. Only, Matt plans to use nothing heavier than a squirt gun on Jenny (Zooey Deschanel), Arthur's daughter, as part of a school-wide game of "killer." When the plans collide, mayhem ensues, and Matt's struggling ex-columnist dad (Tim Allen, loosely modeled on Barry), Arthur's bored wife (Rene Russo), and two confused police officers (Janeane Garofalo and Patrick Warburton) are also called to the scene. Shift to the next day and there's more craziness to follow. Two dimwitted petty criminals (Tom Sizemore and Johnny Knoxville) choose the exact moment Arthur is transacting a nuclear arms deal to hold up the dive bar where they're regulars, which is actually a front for the Russian mob. Soon the whole motley cast -- including an agreeable drifter (Jason Lee), a buxom maid (Sofia Vergara), and a pair of ruthless FBI agents (Heavy D and Omar Epps) -- are caught up in a hostage scenario in which the weapon accidentally gets brought aboard a hijacked plan(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: A man found wandering at New York Central Station is taken into psychiatric care because he claims to be Prot from the planet K-PAX, "1,000 of your light years away". Psychiatrist Dr. Mark Powell doesn't believe him and tries to unlock the trauma, but as Prot reveals knowledge that only a handful of astronomers could know and shows an uncanny knack for helping his fellow patients heal, even Powell begins to wonder. Then clues that Prot lets slip under hypnosis lead Powell to a more earthly explanation, or so he thinks, in Iain Softley's assured, gripping sci-fi fantasy(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A parody of the much-done medieval English tale of Robin Hood and his Merry Men, ROBIN HOOD: MEN IN TIGHTS also directly lampoons the politically correct ROBIN HOOD: PRINCE OF THIEVES, which starred the hearthrob of the time, the very un-British Kevin Costner. English hearthrob Cary Elwes gets a turn in the role of the hero of Sherwood Forest who robs from the rich to give to the poor when he returns from the Crusades to find his beloved King Richard usurped by the evil Prince John..(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt takes on a renegade spy who's stolen a deadly high-tech virus(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Power to the President. Isobel Yeung reports from Turkey as citizens head to the polls in a nationwide referendum that grants President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan unprecedented power(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: 300's Zack Snyder brings Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' critically acclaimed comic book Watchmen to the big screen, courtesy of DC Comics and Warner Bros. Pictures. Set in an alternate universe circa 1985, the film's world is a highly unstable one where a nuclear war is imminent between America and Russia. Superheroes have long been made to hang up their tights thanks to the government-sponsored Keene Act, but that all changes with the death of The Comedian (Jeffrey Dean Morgan), a robust ex-hero commando whose mysterious free fall out a window perks the interest of one of the country's last remaining vigilantes, Rorschach (Jackie Earle Haley). His investigation leads him to caution many of his other former costumed colleagues, including Dr. Manhattan, Night Owl (Patrick Wilson), Ozymandias (Matthew Goode), Sally Jupiter (Carla Gugino), and her daughter, The Silk Spectre (Malin Akerman). Heralded for bringing the world of superheroes into the literary world, Watchmen gave the super-powered mythos a real-life grounding that had been missing in mainstream comics to that point. The film adaptation had languished in one form of development hell or another for years after the book's release, with various directors on and off the project, including Terry Gilliam, David Hayter, and Darren Aronofsky, as well as Paul Greengrass, whose eventual dismissal stemmed from budget conflicts with the studio(n)
