programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Playwright William Shakespeare has hit a dry patch, until the beautiful Viola de Lesseps enters his life and sets his creative juices flowing. Romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorited figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: Spectacular horror movie based on the classic HG Wells novel about a mad scientist and his shocking experiments in genetics. Edward Douglas (David Thewlis) is on a UN mission when his aircraft crashes in the South Pacific. Taken to a remote island which is the domain of the mysterious Dr Moreau (Marlon Brando), Douglas encounters a race of strange, sub-human creatures who intrigue him. Douglas' curiosity draws him into restricted areas, where he is confronted with the full horror of Dr Moreau's genetic experiments on animals and humans. After the Dr's most frightening experiment goes badly wrong, Douglas realises that his own life may be in jeopardy unless he can somehow maintain order - as well as his own sanity(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson plays former cop John Shaft, the nephew of the '70s private eye of the same name, who takes on a racist killer and a Dominican drug lord(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family in this yuletide horror comedy based on ancient folklore(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world in this soaring comic-book extravaganza. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by Lex Luthor(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: From his beginnings on the mean streets of Brooklyn to becoming an East Coast hip-hop sensation, the life and death of rapper Notorious B.I.G. is chronicled in this biopic starring Jamal Woolard and Angela Bassett(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Entrenched in the racial tumult of Los Angeles in the mid-1980's, a group of aspiring rappers banded together to revolutionize the global consumption of hip-hop and popular culture. NWA was born out of racial frustration and the disadvantaged economics of their South Central neighborhood. F. Gary Gray directs this biopic about the rise to stardom for the act that earned the moniker of "The World's Most Dangerous Group", featuring Ice Cube's son O'Shea Jackson Jr. playing the role of his father, Corey Hawkins as Dr. Dre, and Jason Mitchell as the late Eazy-E(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Lorenzo's Oil
programme.desc: A boy develops a disease so rare that nobody is working on a cure, so his father decides to learn all about it and tackle the problem himself(n)

programme.title: The Strange History of Don't Ask, Don't Tell
programme.desc: A look at the U.S. armed forces' ban on gays and lesbians includes remarks from activists, politicians, and active and former service members; and a timeline of the contentious process leading up to the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, which takes effect on Sept. 20, 2011, and allows homosexuals to serve openly for the first time. Directed by Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Jack Black and Mos Def re-enact everything from Ghostbusters to Rush Hour when the tapes in their video store are wiped. Hit slacker comedy from director Michel Gondry. (2008)(97 mins)(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Though Bridget is happily ensconced in the arms of the lovely Mark Darcy her petty jealousies are starting to get the best of her, and their relationship. Chief among these is her suspicions about Mark's long-legged intern, who, on top of being gorgeous, has a knack for doing everything right. To make matters worse Bridget's old fling, and former boss, Daniel Cleaver, arrives on the scene(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: This thrilling action film offers non-stop, runaway adventure down the streets and freeways of L.A. Howard Payne is the psychotic villain who is first seen sabotaging a high-rise elevator. He will spare the passengers in exchange for cash. Enter Jack Traven and the S.W.A.T. team who in a daring rescue save the elevator and shoot Payne. Unfortunately Payne didn't die and later tells Traven his newest scheme: he has wired a Santa Monica bus, travelling during morning rush hour on the freeway, to explode if it goes under 50 mph. Jack gets on board and has to deal with a variety of panicky passengers while trying to gain control of the vehicle helmed by a wounded driver. Annie, recently arrested for speeding, replaces the driver. Now, under pressure from both passengers and headquarters, it is up to Jack to disarm the bomb. After a spectacular scene where the bus jumps a 50 foot gap in an overpass, the police guide it to the airport and disarm it. But Payne is still busy at work. His actions lead to one final, fatal face-off on a hellish subway ride(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Power to the President. Isobel Yeung reports from Turkey as citizens head to the polls in a nationwide referendum that grants President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan unprecedented power(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: In this wild and anarchic "super-antihero" film, a team of incarcerated villains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Playwright William Shakespeare has hit a dry patch, until the beautiful Viola de Lesseps enters his life and sets his creative juices flowing. Romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorited figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: Spectacular horror movie based on the classic HG Wells novel about a mad scientist and his shocking experiments in genetics. Edward Douglas (David Thewlis) is on a UN mission when his aircraft crashes in the South Pacific. Taken to a remote island which is the domain of the mysterious Dr Moreau (Marlon Brando), Douglas encounters a race of strange, sub-human creatures who intrigue him. Douglas' curiosity draws him into restricted areas, where he is confronted with the full horror of Dr Moreau's genetic experiments on animals and humans. After the Dr's most frightening experiment goes badly wrong, Douglas realises that his own life may be in jeopardy unless he can somehow maintain order - as well as his own sanity(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson plays former cop John Shaft, the nephew of the '70s private eye of the same name, who takes on a racist killer and a Dominican drug lord(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family in this yuletide horror comedy based on ancient folklore(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world in this soaring comic-book extravaganza. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by Lex Luthor(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: From his beginnings on the mean streets of Brooklyn to becoming an East Coast hip-hop sensation, the life and death of rapper Notorious B.I.G. is chronicled in this biopic starring Jamal Woolard and Angela Bassett(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Entrenched in the racial tumult of Los Angeles in the mid-1980's, a group of aspiring rappers banded together to revolutionize the global consumption of hip-hop and popular culture. NWA was born out of racial frustration and the disadvantaged economics of their South Central neighborhood. F. Gary Gray directs this biopic about the rise to stardom for the act that earned the moniker of "The World's Most Dangerous Group", featuring Ice Cube's son O'Shea Jackson Jr. playing the role of his father, Corey Hawkins as Dr. Dre, and Jason Mitchell as the late Eazy-E(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: Lorenzo's Oil
programme.desc: A boy develops a disease so rare that nobody is working on a cure, so his father decides to learn all about it and tackle the problem himself(n)

programme.title: The Strange History of Don't Ask, Don't Tell
programme.desc: A look at the U.S. armed forces' ban on gays and lesbians includes remarks from activists, politicians, and active and former service members; and a timeline of the contentious process leading up to the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, which takes effect on Sept. 20, 2011, and allows homosexuals to serve openly for the first time. Directed by Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Jack Black and Mos Def re-enact everything from Ghostbusters to Rush Hour when the tapes in their video store are wiped. Hit slacker comedy from director Michel Gondry. (2008)(97 mins)(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Though Bridget is happily ensconced in the arms of the lovely Mark Darcy her petty jealousies are starting to get the best of her, and their relationship. Chief among these is her suspicions about Mark's long-legged intern, who, on top of being gorgeous, has a knack for doing everything right. To make matters worse Bridget's old fling, and former boss, Daniel Cleaver, arrives on the scene(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain who has sinister plans for his old home(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: This thrilling action film offers non-stop, runaway adventure down the streets and freeways of L.A. Howard Payne is the psychotic villain who is first seen sabotaging a high-rise elevator. He will spare the passengers in exchange for cash. Enter Jack Traven and the S.W.A.T. team who in a daring rescue save the elevator and shoot Payne. Unfortunately Payne didn't die and later tells Traven his newest scheme: he has wired a Santa Monica bus, travelling during morning rush hour on the freeway, to explode if it goes under 50 mph. Jack gets on board and has to deal with a variety of panicky passengers while trying to gain control of the vehicle helmed by a wounded driver. Annie, recently arrested for speeding, replaces the driver. Now, under pressure from both passengers and headquarters, it is up to Jack to disarm the bomb. After a spectacular scene where the bus jumps a 50 foot gap in an overpass, the police guide it to the airport and disarm it. But Payne is still busy at work. His actions lead to one final, fatal face-off on a hellish subway ride(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand
programme.desc: Colin Quinn. Colin Quinn offers his brand of street rap, complaining about his "pathetic" life, '70s sitcoms, Jean-Claude Van Damme films(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
programme.desc: Comedy sequel in which bickering curmudgeons Max and John find plenty more to disagree about - notably the marriage of their respective offspring and the arrival of a sexy Italian woman and her mother, who plan to turn the bait shop into a restaurant. Max and his bawdy old father put John's nose further out of joint by falling for the new arrivals(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: Mikey used to be a child star. These days, he's just a talent scout looking for kids with prospects, until pint-sized Angie picks his pocket. Mikey hears her sob story and sees his ticket back to the big time. Family comedy(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. Moving from Samantha's family home as it's invaded by outre relatives to a high-school dance where nothing seems to go her way, this bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha..(n)

programme.title: Necessary Roughness
programme.desc: After sacking their old team, Texas State University hire a coach to assemble a new football team. The motley crew he collects includes a retired high-school football star, a military fanatic, a physics teacher and, as place kicker, a dishy female. Overcoming all obstacles on and off the field, they attempt to win the championship(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: William Hurt is the slow-thinking, good-looking anchorman competing alongside reporter Albert Brooks for the heart of sharp cookie Holly Hunter. An 80s classic - satire and love in a Washington news bureau, with a supporting cast that includes Joan Cusack and Jack Nicholson(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Mobster Chili Palmer ditches the movie business for the music industry when he decides to manage a singer in this sequel(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Desperate to get their music heard on the radio, members of a heavy-metal band hold a radio station hostage(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: (2001) Gag-meister Jerry Zucker's cracking comedy has a cast to die for. Las Vegas casino owner Donald P Sinclair (John Cleese) decides to set up a special event for his highest rollers. Lucky tokens in his slot machines entitle six punters to enter a race across America with $2million as the prize. He'll make a killing on the bets placed on the players while the contestants (including Rowan Atkinson, Breckin Meyer, Amy Smart, Whoopi Goldberg and Cuba Gooding Jr) dash for the cash. Edited for language. M,W,R,S,(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Packed to the gills with references to mob movies from The Godfather to Casino, the story of an Italian boy who comes to America and becomes entangled with the all-powerful Mafia provides on opportunity for director Jim Abrahams to poke fun at the genre in his distinctive gag-a-minute style using everything from visual puns to verbal acrobatics in his quest to raise a laugh. The gags come thick and fast in this Mafia spoof from the makers of Airplane! and The Naked Gun(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: Mikey used to be a child star. These days, he's just a talent scout looking for kids with prospects, until pint-sized Angie picks his pocket. Mikey hears her sob story and sees his ticket back to the big time. Family comedy(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Comedy adventure set during the Vietnam War about a group of US soldiers who attempt to bring an elephant through the jungle for a friendly native village. A pair of army officers offer to find a new elephant for local villagers when their sacred beast becomes a casualty of war. Along with a trio of hapless assistants, they set off on a mission to deliver the animal to its new home(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a newlywed couple on honeymoon in Europe discover that the girl's disapproving family and ex-boyfriend are following them in an attempt to sabotage their relationship(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. Based on true events(n)

programme.title: Spring Breakdown
programme.desc: A trio of thirtysomething friends (Amy Poehler, Rachel Dratch, and Parker Posey) go vacationing at a popular spring break resort frequented by college coeds in order to prevent a politician's daughter from embarrassing her family. Larry Kennar and Rick Berg produce a script penned by director Ryan Shiraki in collaboration with star Dratch(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two mild-mannered cousins search for a beloved pet kitten after the feline is taken during a home burglary. However, they get in over their heads when their quest leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang by posing as drug dealers(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg stars in Emile Ardolino's comedy thriller as Deloris Van Cartier, a lounge singer at a casino managed by her lover VInce LaRocca (Harvey Keitel). He's also a drugs baron and when she accidentally interrupts him in the process of rubbing out a stool pigeon, she has to run for her life. To keep her safe until LaRocca can be charged, the police arrange for her to become Sister Mary Clarence at a nunnery overseen by stern Mother Superior. But you can't keep a good singer down and Sister Mary has soon so successfully invigorated the choir with her musical talent that the church is packed - and there is even a call from Rome for a Papal performance. Unfortunately, thanks to an inside man in the police department, LaRocca learns of her whereabouts and sets out to prevent her testifying; can her new found friends, the nuns, protect her?(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. Based on true events(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama about five school kids - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - who are brought together on a day-long detention. Despite their original hostilities, and a psychotic teacher, the motley crew break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. programme.title: Mr. Destiny
programme.desc: A dissatisfied businessman in the midst of a mid-life crisis encounters a magical bartender who shows him what might have been in this fantasy. With the bartender, the man tours the life he would have led had he won a high-school baseball game rather than striking out(n)

programme.title: Space Chimps
programme.desc: In Kirk DeMicco's animated film three supersonic simian spacemen take to the cosmos to find a missing probe, and encounter a whole world of trouble along the way. Ham III, the grandson of the first ever chimp in space, is a wise-cracking smart aleck who makes a living being fired from a cannon. When the Infinity Space Probe goes missing, Ham joins a mission to find it. He's been recruited as a PR stunt, but his fellow Space Chimps, Luna and Titan, are highly trained experts. When they crash-land on the planet Malgor, they find a race of aliens who are being oppressed by the tyrannical Zartog, who is using the probe for his own nefarious ends. Can the feckless Ham use his circus skills to save the day, help liberate the aliens, recover the probe, get the girl, and find a way to get back home? This is great fare for all the family, with plenty of deadpan asides to keep grown-ups entertained(n)

he true story of Brooklyn Dodgers hitter Jackie Robinson, who in 1946 became the first African-American Major League baseball player. Chadwick Boseman, TR Knight, Harrison Ford, Nicole Beharie(n)

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: Suited

programme.desc: In this sequel to the urban comedy Friday, rap music star Ice Cube returns as Craig Jones, a streetwise man from South Central Los Angeles who has a knack for getting into trouble. This time out, Craig is still trying to outsmart neighborhood bully Debo (Tommy "Tiny" Lister Jr.); after Craig gets the better of Debo in a fist fight, Debo is determined to flatten Craig in a rematch. Looking to stay out of Debo's way, Craig decides that it would be a good time to visit his cousin (Mike Epps) and uncle (Don "DC" Curry), who have recently won the lottery and moved into a spacious new home in the suburbs. Like Friday, Next Friday was written by Ice Cube and his frequent musical collaborator DJ Pooh; music video director Steve Carr made his feature debut with this film(n)

With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of Snow White and the Huntsman acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna (Charlize Theron) and Freya (Emily Blunt). During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara (Jessica Chastain), since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom. Directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: The acclaimed graphic novel from crime writer Max Allan Collins becomes this big budget Dreamworks drama from director Sam Mendes and screenwriter David Self. Tom Hanks stars as Michael Sullivan, a morally conflicted Depression-era hit man committing murder in the name of his employer, John Rooney (Paul Newman). A kindly, aging Irish crime boss who raised Sullivan as his surrogate son, Rooney is affiliated with Al Capone in Chicago and thus wields great power in the "Tri-Cities" of Moline, IL; Rock Island, IL; and Davenport, IA. Curious about his father's mysterious profession, Sullivan's son, Michael Jr. (Tyler Hoechlin), stows away in his father's automobile one night and witnesses the execution of a man at the hands of Sullivan and Rooney's biological son, Connor (Daniel Craig). Although Michael keeps his promise to remain silent about what he's seen, the paranoid and unstable Connor tries to wipe out the entire Sullivan clan anyway, succeeding only in killing Sullivan's wife, Annie (Jennifer Jason Leigh), and youngest son, Peter (Liam Aiken). Enraged at this and another surprise betrayal by the Rooneys, Sullivan embarks on a path of bloody retribution, Michael in tow. Although he intends to leave his boy with relatives in the rural town of Perdition once the coast is clear, he ends up exposing Michael to the goriest aspects of his talents, slaughtering former associates as he dodges contract assassin Maguire (Jude Law) and cripples the cash flow of the Rooney and Capone organizations through a series of bank robberies, attempting to force either mob family to offer up the sequestered Connor as a sacrifice. Inspired by the popular Japanese comic book series Lone Wolf and Cub and based loosely on an episode from the life and career of notorious real-life crime figures John and Connor Looney, Road to Perdition co-stars Stanley Tucci as legendary Chicago mobster Frank Nitti(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. Of course, wherever Jessica goes, murder follows, and this time the victim is the prison's doctor Irene Matthews (Janet McLachlan). Believing that an innocent woman has been accused of the crime, the inmates stage a riot, taking several hostages--including Jessica--in the process. programme.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: When Taylor (Charlton Heston) disappears, Zira (Kim Hunter) and Brent (James Fanciscus) set out to find the missing explorer. They battle a disfigured group of revolutionaries who worship a nuclear bomb. Led by the Fat Man (Victor Buono), the group battles the apes and the astronauts for control of the territory. The leader of the apes is Dr.Zaius (Maurice Evans), who listens to Nova (Linda Harrison), the female scientist who expresses concern and compassion for the humans. Ursus (James Gregory) is the agitated ape who campaigns for a holy war against the Fat Man and his cronies in this science fiction drama(n)

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.desc: Janey, the owner of two very large pot-bellied pigs, visits the country's leading micro pig breeder to learn more about the miniature breed and see what animals are available. Plus, animal behaviourist Emma Dale travels to Oxshott, Surrey, where glamorous mother-of-two Joanna has two rather spoilt rescue beagles that have an unfortunate habit of fouling her kitchen floor. Cameras also follow an ultra-pampered Chelsea cockapoo as it heads for a two-week canine detox at the country's most exclusive dog hotel.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Joe has an offer Gary may not be able to refuse, and David is furious when he sees Billy helping Shona into No 11. Meanwhile, Erica asks Robert for a job at the Bistro, and Eva is furious when Aidan reveals he's buying the kebab shop flat.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Sheron and Billy Dawson check in for some pool-side fun, bringing along their teenage son Rob, young daughter Jodie, and Grandad Eddie, to claim the sun-loungers left vacant following the Garveys' departure from the vacation spot. Meanwhile, resort boss Joyce Temple-Savage is desperate for new staff, and must choose between efficient, goody two-shoes Amber and the outrageously flirtatious Marcus, and Troy returns to Benidorm with Jacqueline and Kenneth to scatter Donald's ashes in the place he loved best. Julie Graham, Steve Edge and Bobby Knutt join the cast of the comedy drama set in the sun-kissed Solana resort.(n)

programme.title: The Eubanks
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at how Chris Eubank Jr is preparing for his bout against Arthur Abraham, which will see him face arguably his toughest opponent to date. Abraham was born in Armenia, but has been based in Germany for the entirety of his professional career, which has seen him hold legitimate world title belts in two weight divisions, and share a ring with the likes of Jermain Taylor, Andre Dirrell, Andre Ward and Carl Froch.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be India's lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the city's only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbai's tallest luxury residential building.(n)

Dervla Kirwan guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect

Meanwhile, Agnes falls out with Victor when she returns to Selfridges, although Henri is pleased to see her again. Period drama, starring Jeremy Piven.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Gillian Carter from Sheffield became pregnant shortly before her 18th birthday and had hoped to keep the baby with the support of her aunt, but the arrangement fell through due to illness. Now, the 66-year-old is looking forward to a potential reunion with her son. Sandra Macdonald, 53, was given up for adoption in Edinburgh in 1960 and grew up with the feeling something was missing from her life. At the age of 15 she started searching for her birth mother, but she was met by disapproval and misinformation at every turn. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell tell Gillian and Sandra's stories, guiding them through their emotional searches.(n)

programme.desc: Inspector Blake is involved in an accident aboard Stan's bus, so all crews are forced to carry medical kits on their vehicles and undergo First Aid training. Comedy, with Reg Varney and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes disguises himself as a plumber to gain access to the home of a blackmailing art dealer who targets members of high society. Robert Hardy guest stars in a feature-length episode of the period drama, with Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Goodbye Mr Chips
programme.desc: Martin Clunes stars as an earnest Latin master working at the Brookfield School of the 1880s, where he meets and marries his true love Kathie and finds himself touched by politics, grief and the utter devastation of World War One. Charting more than 50 years of one man's extraordinary life, the story ends in the 1930s, as a wise, elderly and much-loved Mr Chipping lives out his last days in retirement. Frank Delaney's adaptation of James Hilton's timeless classic, which has never been out of print since first appearing as a magazine serialisation in 1934, and for which Robert Donat whipped an Oscar from under the nose of Gone with the Wind's Clark Gable in the 1939 film production. Also starring Victoria Hamilton, Conleth Hill and Patrick Malahide.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: When a woman is found strangled, a pathologist detects chilling similarities with a number of unsolved murders - prompting Wycliffe and his team to reopen 11-year-old case files. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Tim Wylton and Helen Masters.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The glamorous Ruth Van Rydock contacts her old friend Jane Marple with a mystery - her sister Carrie Louise's study has been devastated by a suspicious fire. While Carrie Louise has the same cheerful outlook as ever, Ruth fears dark forces are at play at Stonygates, the home Carrie shares with her third husband, various relatives and a motley crew of young criminals, the latest subject of Carrie's philanthropic endeavours. But on the evening before a theatrical show is staged for their guests, one of whom is Miss Marple, an even more fascinating performance takes place before their very eyes - one where the final act is murder. Julia McKenzie stars, with guest appearances from Joan Collins, Penelope Wilton, Brian Cox, Maxine Peake, Alexei Sayle, Sarah Smart, Ian Ogilvy, Sean Hughes and Nigel Terry.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War

The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jake's old nemesis. Then they set off to Hong Kong where they stay at one of the world's top hotels, rent a yacht and have custom-made suits designed by the best tailors. programme.title: Sports Life Stories
programme.desc: A profile of the former boxer, a four-time world super-middleweight champion considered among the elite performers in his weight class. After rising through the domestic ranks and winning both the British and Commonwealth titles, Froch claimed his first world crown by defeating Jean Pascal in 2008, and was a dominant fighter on the world scene from that point on. His legacy was assured in May 2014 when he defeated fellow Brit George Groves in a rematch at Wembley Stadium in what proved to be his final fight. That contest drew the largest attendance for a boxing bout in the UK since the Second World War at 80,000. Last in the series.(n)

Text messages suggest an affair that had progressed to blackmail, but Banks and Morton struggle to find further information about Marcus, as his records only seem to date back five years. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison.(n)

Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners' strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. programme.title: Summer Catch
programme.desc: This blend of sports and youthful romantic comedy is from director Michael Tollin, who previously produced the sports drama Varsity Blues (1999). Freddie Prinze Jr. stars as Ryan Dunne, a ballplayer who's spending the summer as a pitcher for the famed, highly prestigious Cape Cod League, a non-professional farm team that has turned out numerous baseball legends. Ryan's under special pressure on a number of fronts. He's the first local boy to earn a slot in the league in years, and his blue-collar status earns him the enmity of a hot-shot college teammate, Eric Van Leemer (Corey Pearson). Although he's backed up by his best friend and team catcher Billy Brubaker (Matthew Lillard), Ryan adds more stress to his life by embarking on an affair with a beautiful, wealthy young Vassar graduate, Tenley Parrish (Jessica Biel), who's spending the summer on the Cape with her parents. Tenley is facing her own crisis as her father (Bruce Davison) pressures her to move to San Francisco and work with her uncle, though she'd rather remain in the East and become an architect. Summer Catch is the third onscreen teaming of Prinze and Lillard, and also stars Brian Dennehy, Wilmer Valderrama, Jason Gedrick, Fred Ward, and Brittany Murphy(n)

programme.title: Major League II
programme.desc: Sports comedy sequel which sees the return of the Cleveland Indians, a misfit baseball team of bungling amateurs and over-the-hill athletes. The club's owner is happy to see her team lose so that she can get out of her contractual obligations to the players - but they have other ideas(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After years spent dedicated to their demanding careers in nursing and social work, Gillian and Paul Clarke from Stockport have decided it's time to start taking it a little easier and put themselves first. They've got their hearts set on a holiday home on Spain's Costa Calida where they can boogie their way to retirement. Jonnie Irwin shows the couple five properties for their budget of £45,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Ye Olde Fighting Cocks in Arnside, Cumbria, where owners Tony Keates and Jeanette Hamer hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, while the B&B's guests are bowled over by the spectacular views, they are less than impressed by Tony's tales of business success and a mouldy mattress.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Hadleigh, Suffolk, where Dr Stephen Stanley-Little invites fellow B&B owners to come and stay at his tranquil country setting - Westward Cottage. He takes his guests on a historic village tour that leaves one couple plotting their escape, while the host's relaxed approach to breakfast drives some of the others mad.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host are bohemian couple Avril Berry and Alan Fraser of Roulotte Retreat in Melrose on the Scottish borders. Their unique gypsy caravans are not to everyone's liking, and a yoga class fails to calm the tensions that seem to be rising within the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Elgin Hotel, Blackpool, where manager Garry Lloyd and his daughter Sophie Seddon want to demonstrate how their 89-room business can still deliver a personal touch. The hosts arrange an afternoon of tap-dancing lessons, ending with a surprise performance at the iconic Grand Theatre, but a breakfast mix-up the following morning puts some of the guests nonplussed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Birmingham pair Derek Hansel and Gina Awoko are looking for a home in Almeria, Spain, that they can eventually retire to and also generate some rental income from. Jasmine Harman shows them a range of properties within their £300,000 budget, from a coastal renovation project to an inland cortijo. However, it remains to be seen whether she can deliver the perfect property in the perfect location.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Having sold a successful business, Ruth and Philip Trinder from Northamptonshire want to buy an apartment on the Balearic island of Mallorca, where they can spend half the year. They want somewhere they can entertain family and friends, within easy walking distance of one of the island's stylish ports. With a budget of £300,000 Laura Hamilton sets out to help them find something with the contemporary look they love.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team heads to the small county of Rutland to visit Oakham Castle, the most well-preserved 12th-century building in Britain. It was once home to the Norman knight Walkelin de Ferrers, who fought alongside Richard the Lionheart in the Crusades, and before that the residence of several Saxon kings and queens. Tony and the crew investigate de Ferrers' long-lost private quarters, but it takes three days of twists and turns to determine what the site looked like 900 years ago. To mark the visit, they also cast a giant Time Team horseshoe to add to the collection that has decorated the castle hall for half a millennium.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts head to a field in south Oxfordshire where significant findings were made by an inquisitive PhD student half a century ago, including a mosaic and the stone walls of a former Roman building. Tony Robinson and the crew examine aerial pictures showing clear building lines in the ground, and speak to the current landowner, a farmer who continues to uncover bricks and tiles. They try to evaluate the building's purpose and how the Thames may have shifted the remains over the course of two millennia.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend take on ake on a 1934 Singer Le Mans two-seater sports Presenter Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend take on a 1934 Singer Le Mans two-seater sports car owned by 70-year-old farmer John from Cambridgeshire. The car's last outing was in 1998, when it had a starring role in a glorious wedding. The boys have to retrieve the car from a dusty barn, but once they have it back at the workshop, they discover the engine is in a very poor state and find they may have to replace it.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A boxer dog is brought in with extensive injuries to its pelvis and hind legs from a road accident. Pioneering surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick considers a stem-cell scaffolding procedure - but there are significant risks attached. He and his team also help different animals with broken legs, including hedgehogs, and a kitten that has had an accident at home.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A woman arrives with 14 of her rescue dogs, including a tiny papillon in need of a double knee replacement. Noel and his team also fit a German shepherd with a specially designed bionic foot, and treat a mountain dog that is suffering problems with its spine.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits London artists Freddie Robins and Ben Coode-Adams, who left their cramped flat and took on the conversion of a Grade II-listed timber-framed barn in the Essex countryside. At seven times the size of the average three-bedroom house, the project proved very challenging, but also gave them plenty of opportunity to be creative.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: Part two of two. A local `wellness expert' is found murdered in unusual circumstances. There are several suspects in the frame, but Dicte and Wagner find themselves chasing down a secret lover. Despite overwhelming evidence in one direction, the pair cannot shake the feeling that something doesn't add up. Dicte accidentally comes between Torsten and Anne when dealing with Rose, who wants to leave home, and when she unearths a fresh lead in the case of the `wellness queen', she finds a mysterious gift that the victim had given to a gardener with learning disabilities. Meanwhile, things get more serious between Bo and Dicte, and Wagner is oblivious to an office romance. Crime drama, starring Iben Hjejle, Lars Brygmann, Laerke Winther, Lars Ranthe, Dar Salim and Emilie Claudius Kruse. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff of King's College Hospital reflect on the different ways in which people deal with physical and emotional pain as they treat a new batch of patients. Ahmed, 28, dislocated his shoulder during a game of American football and grits his teeth as a doctor slots it back into place. Meanwhile, 24-year-old Lee is living with Behcet's disease, a condition that affects his nervous system and causes pain so severe he passes out, and father-of-four Simon, 30, has been found unconscious at the bottom of a stairwell and it emerges he hasn't eaten for days following a relationship break-up.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Senior nurse Scott deals with a very busy shift in resus, where every bed is occupied and patients continue to arrive, including 56-year-old Pauline, who has hit her head in an accident at home. Aerial fitter David, 62, has life-threatening injuries after falling 30ft from a roof, while opera critic John is in minors with a bad ankle, and 78-year-old former window cleaner Alfred talks about coming to terms with his wife's death.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits London artists Freddie Robins and Ben Coode-Adams, who left their cramped flat and took on the conversion of a Grade II-listed timber-framed barn in the Essex countryside. At seven times the size of the average three-bedroom house, the project proved very challenging, but also gave them plenty of opportunity to be creative.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Fern Brady, Phil Spencer, Carol Vorderman and Henning Wehn to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads to Thailand to find out about the surprising that makes a prawn cracker unique, while Matt Tebbutt visits Britain's largest producer of fresh herbs to learn about a new hi-tech method of extending shelf-life. Kate Quilton investigates what actually goes into sodium-replacement salts and examines whether salt really deserves its unhealthy reputation.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Craft mason and mountain rescuer Pete Roe is called out to try and find a puppy that has fallen down a 50-foot sinkhole near Wensleydale.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Debra Mann from Reading, Berkshire, has fallen in love with the Bay of the Somme in the north of France, and has set heart on a holiday getaway where she and her sister can spend time with family and friends. Scarlette Douglas shows them both a selection of properties for a £64,000 budget - with plenty of surprises along the way.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire couple Martin and Michelle MacClay want a holiday home in France's Loire Valley, so Scarlette Douglas helps find them the perfect property on a budget of £73,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Gary Fitzpatrick and Shahine Korimbocus want a holiday home in the tranquil Limousin area of France where they can enjoy an outdoor lifestyle with their 20-month-old twins Charlie and Catherine, and Gary's son Dominic. Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Francophiles Madeline and Andy Morton from Portsmouth are looking for a holiday home they can fly or drive to in the rural landscapes of the Charente region in west-central France. With cash savings of £45,000, they're hoping for a traditional two-bedroom home with charm and character. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, hoping that one will be their dream house.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist and female impersonator Marcus Hunter-Neill hopes to impress with a red carpet-themed evening as he hosts the first party in Belfast. However, his alter ego Lady Portia Diamante steals the limelight as he competes for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jamaican lifeguard Lenny Irving serves up Caribbean cuisine at the second of the week's dinner parties in Belfast. He also hopes to win over his guests by complementing his menu with strong rum - and seems particularly keen to impress Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Freelance feminist writer Cat Anderson hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to win over her guests with her bohemian chic style and live music. However, her efforts are wasted on lifeguard Lenny Irving, who is only interested in Fiona Rush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner-party challenge from Belfast is hosted by charity worker and confident cook Rosie Smyth. She decides the best way to win over her guests is to have a `come-as-your-teenage-self' evening, and a zingy mojito cheesecake.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush hosts the final dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to impress with a nautical-themed evening. However, one of her guests is unimpressed with the amount of fish on the menu, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Times Guesthouse in Ipswich, Suffolk, where mother-and-daughter duo Linda and Kelly Langdown hope a go-karting session will get the contest off to a flying start. However, a lack of breakfast options and corner-cutting on the guests' orders do not go down very well.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit the Flower Pot in Sunbury-on-Thames on their second night, where owner Simon Bailey and French manager Pierre Cudon provide stylish continental-inspired accommodation, but the hosts are left puzzled by some of the feedback they receive the next morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the family-run Dolphin Hotel in Exmouth, Devon, which has been a life's work for hotelier Jo Knowles. On arrival, Pat and Nigel find a suspicious stain, before the guests put on their war faces for a game of paintball. Jo takes everyone to a floating restaurant for dinner, and the next morning she presents a huge spread for breakfast - but her diners are suspicious that it has been laid on specially for the competition.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants stay at the Mariners Beachside B&B in Seaton, Devon, but are disappointed by the cleanliness of the property. They take part in a town-crying competition during the afternoon, and host Nigel feels under pressure to deliver his award-winning breakfast the next morning. Come feedback time, the owners discover not all their guests share the same opinion.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid, and confront their rivals. Simon Bailey and Pierre Cudon from the Flower Pot feel the feedback left by Nigel and Pat Booth is a step too far, while the Mariners B&B owners hit back at the men's opinion of their establishment's cleanliness. Linda and Kelly Langdown of the Old Times Guest House question the rating of their facilities, while the Dolphin Hotel's Jo Knowles has a confession to make regarding her hosting.(n)

programme.title: The Queen's Mother-in-Law
programme.desc: The story of Prince Philip's mother Princess Alice, a great-granddaughter of Queen Victoria who married into the Greek royal family, but was forced into exile when revolutionaries overthrew the monarchy. She then suffered a severe nervous breakdown, which led to spells in mental hospitals and experimental treatment from psychiatrists including Sigmund Freud. The trauma had a shattering effect on her marriage and led to a fractured childhood for her only son. However, she eventually won her battle with mental illness and became an unlikely hero during the Second World War, risking her life to hide a Jewish family from the Nazis, before dedicating the rest of her life to working with the poor in Greece.(n)

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas returns to narrate another light-hearted retrospective poking fun at Britain's viewing habits in the 1970s. This time, he focuses on the world of comedy, unfettered as it was to the conventions of political correctness. A selection of clips from hit TV shows illustrate how, if viewers were not straight, white, middle-class men, they were at risk of being offended, and highlights examples from On the Buses, The Two Ronnies, Dave Allen at Large and The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club. Includes commentary and contributions by Melvyn Hayes, Eric Chappell, Bill Oddie, Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Grace Dent, Nish Kumar, Ellie Taylor, Joel Dommett and Phil Wang.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from the 1970s, focusing on the comedies, documentaries and public information films that made people so anxious 40 years ago. Some of the famous shows covered include Man Alive and Brass Tacks, as well as The Goodies taking on the police and June Whitfield burning her bra. The show features first-hand accounts from the people who were making telly at the time, including Barry Cryer, Janet Street-Porter and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Everybody Finds Out
programme.desc: The One Where Everybody Finds Out. A focal point for many of this season's episodes, Monica (Courteney Cox) and Chandler's (Matthew Perry) secret romance is revealed here. Ugly Naked Guy is moving out and Ross (David Schwimmer) wants his apartment. To gain an upper hand in a flurry of bids, Ross goes nude with him. Looking out their window, Joey notices that Ugly Naked Guy has a friend; a shocked Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) proclaims, "It's Naked Ross!" While checking out Ross' new apartment, Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) looks out the window and sees Monica and Chandler having sex. Deciding to use the information to play jokes on them, Phoebe begins making passes at Chandler. This leads to a flirting showdown between the two where they kiss and freak each other out. Soon everyone knows about Monica and Chandler except Ross, who eventually sees them kiss out of his new apartment's window. This episode originally aired on February 11, 1999(n)

Having adjusted to the romance between his sister Monica (Courteney Cox) and Chandler (Matthew Perry), Ross (David Schwimmer) finds himself a pariah when he refuses to donate 100 dollars to the apartment janitor's going-away gift. programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: It's the last week of the heats, and the first three chefs are set a task by Marcus, who wants them to fillet a whole plaice, steam a portion and serve it with a mushroom cream sauce, all in 20 minutes. The remaining three cooks are set a Skills Test by Monica, who asks them make the classic Crepe Suzette. Finally, the six contestants cook their Signature Dish. They have 75 minutes to perfectly execute their tried and tested recipe for Monica, Marcus and Gregg.(n)

What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.(n)

Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays' home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. programme.desc: On a slow news day, Josh and the president devise a plan to rescue Toby's deal from certain disaster after a persistent reporter fishes for a scoop. Rina finds a friend in Donna, and CJ meets with an attache to discuss cabbage imports. Drama, starring Martin Sheen, Bradley Whitford and Janel Moloney.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: The Penningtons, owners of Muncaster Castle in the Lake District, discuss the challenges of housing three generations of their family under one roof, while elderly patriarch Patrick struggles to find new purpose following the death of his wife. At Maunsel House in Somerset, Sir Benjamin Slade's preconceptions are challenged when a gay men's choir arrives for a weekend break.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: At Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, Sir Humphrey Wakefield prepares to hand over the estate to his apprehensive son Maximilian. Hard-working staff at Carlton Towers in North Yorkshire get ready for the arrival of 120 caravan owners for the annual rally and dinner dance.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. Spring is in the air, and the town is a hive of activity as skippers return their pleasure yachts to the water after winter in the dry dock, while the pressure is on for Brixham to look its best for the arrival of Princess Anne, who will officially open the new £20million fish market, and the start of the summer season.(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur 13
programme.desc: In 1990, paleontologist Peter Larson and his team from the Black Hills Institute made one of history's greatest dinosaur discoveries; the largest and most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil ever found. The documentary details the true story behind the discovery, as well as the struggle that surrounded it, including a 10-year battle with the US government, museums, Native American tribes and competing paleontologists.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The grumpy medic is convinced a man with serious lung damage and a skin rash has been poisoned by heavy metals. He wonders whether the patient's wife is involved - though the team contend that the tests disprove the diagnosis. Meanwhile, House tires of having Wilson stay with him. Hugh Laurie and Robert Sean Leonard star.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctors struggle to find out why a girl suffers an allergic reaction in a sterile room after a heart transplant, until her boyfriend admits sneaking in for a late-night visit. After questioning him closely, House believes medication being taken by her partner could be the cause, but soon realises her problem is far more complicated. Michelle Trachtenberg guest stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A boy's symptoms remind House of a previous patient, who died before her condition could be diagnosed. Hugh Laurie plays the grumpy medic.(n)
